commit_message:
[ceph-client] Set target size ratio of pools for pg autoscaling

Setting the target size ratio of each pool initially which will
autoscale the num of pgs immediately before any data is written to
the pools. This will reduce backfilling as data is written as the
autoscaling would have been done when the pool was first created.

Change-Id: I00b5372d669068621577ae0fe370219a4aa53b6f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-17 12:02:13.000000000', 'message': 'Make Fluentd config folders readable

Currently, config folders lack the execute bit so Fluentd
cannot read the config and just does nothing when it starts up. This
change explicitly sets the execute bit on folders which need it,
rather that doing it recursively which is more risky from a security
perspective.

Change-Id: Ia840f4b67043df4eaa654f47673dcdc973f13d9c
Closes-Bug: #1867754
'}, {'created': '2020-03-17 12:07:19.000000000', 'message': 'Make Fluentd config folders readable

Currently, config folders lack the execute bit so Fluentd
cannot read the config and just does nothing when it starts up. This
change explicitly sets the execute bit on folders which need it,
rather than doing it in a more generic way which is more risky from
a security perspective.

Change-Id: Ia840f4b67043df4eaa654f47673dcdc973f13d9c
Closes-Bug: #1867754
'}]
commit_message:
Make Fluentd config folders readable

Currently, config folders lack the execute bit so Fluentd
cannot read the config and just does nothing when it starts up. This
change explicitly sets the execute bit on folders which need it,
rather than doing it in a more generic way which is more risky from
a security perspective.

Change-Id: Ia840f4b67043df4eaa654f47673dcdc973f13d9c
Closes-Bug: #1867754

Seems like we should be setting a valid format, but this will keep things working as they were.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-17 17:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-16 22:10:46.000000000', 'message': 'Disable logger validation during unit testing

The unit tests set format to "dummy", which gets rejected by Python 3.8
by default due to newly added validation here:

  https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/18fb1fb943b7dbd7f8a76017ee2a67ef13effb85

We can skip this and restore old behavior by disabling validation.

Change-Id: I22ba9c4437787c3f338f17a0b006132b0dd09df5
'}, {'created': '2020-03-17 07:39:14.000000000', 'message': 'Disable logger validation during unit testing

The unit tests set format to "dummy", which gets rejected by Python 3.8
by default due to newly added validation here:

  https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/18fb1fb943b7dbd7f8a76017ee2a67ef13effb85

We can skip this and restore old behavior by disabling validation.

Change-Id: I22ba9c4437787c3f338f17a0b006132b0dd09df5
'}]
commit_message:
Disable logger validation during unit testing

The unit tests set format to "dummy", which gets rejected by Python 3.8
by default due to newly added validation here:

  https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/18fb1fb943b7dbd7f8a76017ee2a67ef13effb85

We can skip this and restore old behavior by disabling validation.

Change-Id: I22ba9c4437787c3f338f17a0b006132b0dd09df5

commit_message:
Fix native openvswitch firewall driver in neutron-openvswitch-agent

ovs-ofctl is still being run by neutron-openvswitch-agent.
Potential removal is scheduled for Victoria.
Until then, we have to mount /run/openvswitch in there.

Change-Id: Ia73b5665cece523bb822f6a223335f6fae94fb6a
Closes-bug: #1867506
(cherry picked from commit cf918fbc294be35f662d6b2851f3cdc00bc2b1bb)

commit_message:
Disable Fluentd Monasca plugin retry limit

By default a retry limit of 17 exists. When the limit is reached buffered
logs are discarded. To avoid this, we disable the retry limit. The risk of
bringing down the host by filling the Fluent data docker volume is managed
by the maximum buffer size which is 2GB by default.

In summary, after this change, the net behaviour is that Fluentd should
buffer up to a maximum of 2GB of logs locally, and attept to post them to
the Monasca Log API at intervals not exceeding 30 minutes.

Closes-Bug: #1855702
Change-Id: I0d5a3dab29635c00411f4f51e5a0721726df2abd

https://www.webucator.com/blog/2016/05/when-to-use-static-methods-in-python-never/"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-26 17:24:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(6 comments)

thanks sylvain
ill think about this and adress your feedback tomorow

i know that people want to have the flaten function less complicated so ill do that. i also want to avoid use needless wasting memroy and copying data around as this really adds up over time which is why im trying to create one function we know works well and can be reused.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-26 21:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-08-26 22:46:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
libvirt: Report storage bus traits

Add dynamic trait reporting based on the currently enabled virt type.

Change-Id: I1c31cfd317d089026fa30d401157f661b6049cd3
Partially-Implements: blueprint image-metadata-prefiltering
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

We need to include few parameters in the containers-prepare-parameters.yaml
file to be able to perform the upgrade from Queens to Train, one set is the
ceph3_namespace parameters and the other one the Stein namespace ones. So
far they are being hardcoded in the parameters default, so it is possible
to override them if needed.

Change-Id: I4601e9d32ea3cd29a8f80189984e0259d3f29cf4
(cherry picked from commit fb48a1fe68e1542e4191615e79abd057a8864495)

commit_message:
Add needed parameters in containers-prepare-parameters for FFWD2.

We need to include few parameters in the containers-prepare-parameters.yaml
file to be able to perform the upgrade from Queens to Train, one set is the
ceph3_namespace parameters and the other one the Stein namespace ones. So
far they are being hardcoded in the parameters default, so it is possible
to override them if needed.

Change-Id: I4601e9d32ea3cd29a8f80189984e0259d3f29cf4
(cherry picked from commit fb48a1fe68e1542e4191615e79abd057a8864495)

commit_message:
Add ability to set the domain name in the Nagios chart

This allows the ability to set the domain name in the
Nagios deployment. This change goes along with a change
to imageswhich will allow the ability to append the
domain name to the host name in Nagios so the full
FQDN appears in the dashboard.

Change-Id: I512112921111e49345f19dfca70406b56dd55452

commit_message:
Add note about Queens only roles

These roles are only supported for Queens as we replaced the
functionality with the `tripleo container image prepare` process in
Rocky.

commit_message:
Add overcloud node provide role

Adds tripleo_overcloud_node_provide role to set overcloud
nodes in manageable state to available.

Change-Id: I644fe3997d356b9cad930188394adee112c1f199

commit_message:
Ensures that COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE usage is fair

This patch poisons the synchronized decorator in the unit test
to prevent adding you synchronized methods without the fair=True
flag.

Change-Id: I739025dacbcaa0f7adbe612c064f979bf6390880
Related-Bug: #1864122

commit_message:
Remove the dependency on the "mock" package

Now that we are python3 only, we should move to using the built
in version of mock that supports all of our testing needs and
remove the dependency on the "mock" package.

This patch moves all references to "import mock" to
"from unittest import mock". It also cleans up some new line
inconsistency.

Change-Id: Ie7567134a7c0ffae525d0282773e4c90a3f2d62b

commit_message:
monasca-transform: Use python3 for compileall

On CentOS 8, we do not have a generic "python" executable, so let's
be explicit and use python3.

Change-Id: I042d2abd4b690f5c27bee71713ca769112f4b9ec

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-40964 : FAILURE in 3h 28m 23s'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-02-12 09:12:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

tl;dr network-vif-plugged failures during the evacuation of an instance.

network-vif-plugged-4c8529e8-18e5-46c2-9ea4-71f08a321b57 received before we are waiting for it:

7083 Feb 11 23:02:56.125520 ubuntu-bionic-rax-ord-0014512063 nova-compute[8230]: DEBUG nova.compute.manager [req-f48f7ba7-6def-45bb-a5ae-22217c9b50e6 req-45347687-bb01-495a-9728-86d838c3b77e service nova] [instance: 354910cd-7cae-4a91-b380-a8b3121aa579] Received event network-vif-plugged-4c8529e8-18e5-46c2-9ea4-71f08a321b57 {{(pid=8230) external_instance_event /opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py:10061}}
[..]
086 Feb 11 23:02:56.129957 ubuntu-bionic-rax-ord-0014512063 nova-compute[8230]: DEBUG nova.compute.manager [req-f48f7ba7-6def-45bb-a5ae-22217c9b50e6 req-45347687-bb01-495a-9728-86d838c3b77e service nova] [instance: 354910cd-7cae-4a91-b380-a8b3121aa579] No waiting events found dispatching network-vif-plugged-4c8529e8-18e5-46c2-9ea4-71f08a321b57 {{(pid=8230) pop_instance_event /opt/stack/new/nova/nova/compute/manager.py:358}}
7087 Feb 11 23:02:56.130322 ubuntu-bionic-rax-ord-0014512063 nova-compute[8230]: WARNING nova.compute.manager [req-f48f7ba7-6def-45bb-a5ae-22217c9b50e6 req-45347687-bb01-495a-9728-86d838c3b77e service nova] [instance: 354910cd-7cae-4a91-b380-a8b3121aa579] Received unexpected event network-vif-plugged-4c8529e8-18e5-46c2-9ea4-71f08a321b57 for instance with vm_state error and task_state rebuilding.

We start waiting for network-vif-plugged-4c8529e8-18e5-46c2-9ea4-71f08a321b57 a few seconds later:

this is an anti pattern.
in nova i know we started this way but grouping privileged functions in specific modules is not what we should be doing.

this is why we had to add the hacking rule to prevent you shortening the name of any privileged function you import. it also encurages createing more generic functions that have more privladges then they need for there typical useage.

what we should be doing is placing specialised function in the same modules where they are used with the minimal set of privileges via the use of multiple privsep contexts.

now that we have finally got rid of rootwrap we should stop adding more function in nova.privsep and start moving them out into the modules where they are used.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-03-10 14:23:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> this is an anti pattern.
 > in nova i know we started this way but grouping privileged
 > functions in specific modules is not what we should be doing.

Well I can't recall this ever coming up before, I've just being going by the recent work in the codebase.

 > this is why we had to add the hacking rule to prevent you
 > shortening the name of any privileged function you import. it also
 > encurages createing more generic functions that have more
 > privladges then they need for there typical useage.

Which hacking rule?

I'm specifically defaulting to the unprivileged call for existing nova.virt.images.qemu_img_info callers here so I'm not entirely sure what your point is.

FWIW I think we actually need @nova.privsep.sys_admin_pctxt.entrypoint in this use case to be able to read host block devices.

 > what we should be doing is placing specialised function in the same
 > modules where they are used with the minimal set of privileges via
 > the use of multiple privsep contexts.

I really fail to see how moving this particular function up to nova.virt.images makes any difference tbh.

 > now that we have finally got rid of rootwrap we should stop adding
 > more function in nova.privsep and start moving them out into the
 > modules where they are used.

Again this is the first I'm hearing of this change in direction regarding privsep. I'd like to see it agreed upon across the board before moving that way in this series."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-03-10 14:25:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

 > same
 > > modules where they are used with the minimal set of privileges

 > > the use of multiple privsep contexts.

 > > now that we have finally got rid of rootwrap we should stop
 > adding
 > > more function in nova.privsep and start moving them out into the
 > > modules where they are used.
 > 
 > Hmm, really? My understanding was that anything that needed root
 > access had to go into 'nova.privsep' now, just as anything
 > oslo.config related went into 'nova.conf'. Is what you're
 > suggesting documented anywhere?
not entirely

so the last time we discussed this in the context of nova was at the train ptg in relation to this mail thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/004358.html

the end of that thread was http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005366.html

the summary being 
 1- introduce privsep
>> 2- change rootwrap calls into generic privsep functions
>> 3- start refactoring calling code so that generic privsep functions can
>> be replaced by narrow, context-aware functions

a partial attempt to ducment this was done via 
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649997/5/doc/source/user/index.rst
however i did not get a chance to review that before it was merged even though i discussed this at some lenght on irc and at the ptg.

now https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.privsep/latest/user/index.html
is better then it was but i still consider it to not go anywhere near far enough and i dont think that blindly following it produces secure software.

the two recommentation i would have asked to be included that are not are the removal of rhe recommenation that "Functions are defined in files under the privsep/ subdirection" as that encuranges aggreation of cuntion and there eventual reuse in contodiction to the assertion that "Privileged functions must be as simple, specialized and narrow as possible, so as to prevent further escalation."

if they are reusable they are not as simple, specialized and narrow as possible. therefore they should be defiend inline in the the module that consumes them.

the second alteration i would make is that all privileged funciton should have privileged in there name.

so instead of update_motd it should be update_motd_privileged.

this removes the need for the hacking check that enforces 
the recommendation you never shorten the import.

"It is better to import the complete path (import nova.privsep.motd) rather than the motd name (from nova.privsep import motd) so that it is easier to spot that the function runs in a different privileged context."


if they are in the same module they dont need to be imported but if they are are imported it allows use to use the normal 
"from x import y_privileged"
style as long as we dont use "from x import y_privileged as y" to alias it as the function name indicate its privileged at the call site.


the last time i was asked to weigh in on the best practice for privsep useage was in the context of cyborg

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673957/8//COMMIT_MSG@14
where i tried to document this anti pattern and give the same advice i have above.

for the sake of backporting i understand why we dont want to change this too much but one example of a change that would be good to make is would chaning unprivileged_qemu_img_info
to qemu_img_info
and qemu_img_info to qemu_img_info_privileged

the defualt is wrong here. funciton should be unprivaldged by default and we should be calling out when they are privileged.

secondly we ideally would not pass in the path but instead constructed it in that funciton based in the instance uuid, nova config and or other data.
this is inline with the update_motd example where the path is not passed in for the same reason. in this case we cant hard code it but we know how the image path is constucted since nova choose it.


im not going to block on refactoring this since i know the intennt is to backport it but we should avoid this patteren going forward and start to undo the current centralisation and intoduce multiple less privaldges contexts. for example in this case there is no reason for this function ot have CAP_SYS_ADMIN or CAP_NET_ADMIN it just need the filesystem capablities and even then not all of them.

what i have advocated in the past is we should have 3 addtional context in nova. first one that is just cap_net_admin, that is the only capablity os-vif uses and evenuatlly we might be able to remove it entirly if all network opertaion wehre done by os-vif.
second we shoudl have one that is for file acesss. and finally we shoudl have one that is just cap_sys_admin.  those 3 new context would be added in addtion to the current one and we should always select the lowest privaldge context that works.

as it stands privsep in nova really does provide very little security.
and new project like cyborg should not emultate how we currently use privsep in nova.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-03-10 18:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

security aside i dont think the organisation of where constants are defined or the wraping of the funciton with a run_as_root parmater are correct so im adding back my -1.

commit_message:
images: Move qemu-img info calls into privsep

This is mostly code motion from the nova.virt.images module into privsep
to allow for both privileged and unprivileged calls to be made.

A privileged_qemu_img_info function is introduced allowing QEMU to
access devices requiring root privileges, such as host block devices.

Change-Id: I5ac03f923d9d181d22d44d8ec8fbc31eb0c3999e

commit_message:
octavia-tempest-plugin: fix go build for CentOS 8

We need to add "-compressdwarf=false" to the go build flags, or
the generated RPM will fail to find the debug information.

Change-Id: I8f6feaad35ba4145a35fa1966fcb5d15d6042b70

commit_message:
Refactor memcached_servers

This patch aims to add a prefix for memcached_server
on each role to give the ability for deployers to
override the location of memcached cluster. I.e users
wants to create a single memcached cluster with k8s
for each service.

We also add pymemcache based on [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/711429

Change-Id: If7bbef32ae1102ff586bd765052d984896bde43d

commit_message:
Add python2-requests back into skip removal.

When upgrading the Undercloud's operating system we need to
avoid the removal of python2-requests as that's a dependency
for leapp.

Change-Id: I6a0308bd504418fb8a92e8dbfd19786f9b92ff0f
(cherry picked from commit 775238edcc23dff5b3dd0b782aec73717bd58885)

[{'created': '2020-02-20 21:09:29.000000000', 'message': "Switch to hacking 2.0

In hacking 2.0, local-check-factory was removed as it is not compatible
with flake8 3.x and it is advised to use flake8's local plugins [1].
Checks specific to neutron-lib registered via local-check-factory are
converted into flake8's local plugins [2].

Note that neutron_lib.hacking.checks.factory is kept not to break hacking
checks in neutron-lib consumers. They need to be converted into the style
in hacking 2.x in each repository and then we can drop the factory here.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/hacking/unreleased.html#relnotes-2-0-0
[2] https://flake8.pycqa.org/en/3.7.0/user/configuration.html#using-local-plugins

commit_message:
Switch to hacking 2.0

In hacking 2.0, local-check-factory was removed as it is not compatible
with flake8 3.x and it is advised to use flake8's local plugins [1].
Checks specific to neutron-lib registered via local-check-factory are
converted into flake8's local plugins [2].

Note that neutron_lib.hacking.checks.factory is kept not to break hacking
checks in neutron-lib consumers. They need to be converted into the style
in hacking 2.x in each repository and then we can drop the factory here.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/hacking/unreleased.html#relnotes-2-0-0
[2] https://flake8.pycqa.org/en/3.7.0/user/configuration.html#using-local-plugins

Change-Id: I90419fe0b385e7bee216a52c1169aba6d6975d56

# podman system migrate
Error: Error shutting down container storage: A layer is mounted: layer is in use by a container'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2020-03-17 17:10:44.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

We can't reproduce this in CI, and there are limitation in the update framework that makes this operation very complicated as we have to shutdown all container on every overcloud node.

For instance HA service react very badly to this if fencing is on (the node just reboot), so HA services should be stopped in a specific way.

ceph will rebalance by default unless we trigger a no rebalance before doing the osd, but delegation to another node is tricky.

Overall and given the lack of reproducer and the fact that it's a one shot action, better leave it as a manual one."}]

commit_message:
[stein only] WIP Make podman update from 1.0.5 to 1.4.2.

We need to migrate the lock when we update from podman 1.0 to >=1.1.

commit_message:
Added files to allow cleanup when stack delete is called

By invoking the tasks and script added for this commit, a deployer
can clean up all the services and subhosts for a host that is being
deleted.  This is to be invoked when the stack itself is deleted
and is like a "nuke" option.

Ultimately, we'd like to replace the python code here with ansible
calls, but only when support is added for listing services by managed
subhost in ansible-freeipa.

Change-Id: Ia7d41265f3a470421234ebd98f6cbabc772359ac

Thsi patch ads code to check for the existence of a host entry with a

ready yet.  But posting this is useful for testing.

commit_message:
Make sure not to re-enroll already enrolled server

The current code will attempt to re-enroll an existing server,
causing the keytab to be regenerated.  This results in authentication
errors when director is rerun (for an update for instance)

This patch ads code to check for the existence of a host entry with a
keytab.  If so, the server is already enrolled and need not be
re-enrolled.

Co-Authored-By: Grzegorz Grasza <xek@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id389bf97b5e73a0bb8ef924196cc1716188f7848

commit_message:
[OVN] Updates to tools/migrate_names.txt

Updates to tools/migrate_names.txt to correctly represent
mapping between neutron and networking-ovn.

networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py        neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/commands.py
networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py
networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovn_api.py         neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/api.py
networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py   neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py
networking_ovn/ovsdb/worker.py          neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/worker.py

Change-Id: Icc4a9da85e69560c8980f75bcad44564e6f4906e

commit_message:
Register DNSMASQ_OPTS in functional sanity tests

test_dnsmasq_version() is sometimes triggering a traceback
because the new dnsmasq_enable_addr6_list config option isn't
being found. Register the option in the test class.

Change-Id: Ie441f831bcd0835ae8e1cd082005640b65b7393a
Closes-bug: #1866129

commit_message:
Refactor memcached_servers

This patch aims to add a prefix for memcached_server
on each role to give the ability for deployers to
override the location of memcached cluster. I.e users
wants to create a single memcached cluster with k8s
for each service.

We also add pymemcache based on [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/711429

Change-Id: I7e3b2835f1cee2525b02960e2b7e4ee238373bcc

commit_message:
Refactor memcached_servers

This patch aims to add a prefix for memcached_server
on each role to give the ability for deployers to
override the location of memcached cluster. I.e users
wants to create a single memcached cluster with k8s
for each service.

We also add pymemcache based on [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/711429

Change-Id: Ibf64fc04bd9b4359de902a92aa39cfc2923c8823

commit_message:
Align python-octaviaclient to octavia coding style

When removing the "mock" module from python-octaviaclient, it was
clear that python-octaviaclient did not follow the same coding
style guides as the main octavia project.

This patch corrects that by updating the code style checks in
python-octaviaclient to those of the octavia repository and
corrects any style issues found by the new tests.

Change-Id: I505b3e139217ff7d4952880dec304eb5667ae310

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-09-25 10:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-09-25 11:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-09-26 08:20:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think this should be fixed in TripleO and puppet-ironic?
The mtu is'nt set because the dnsmasq.conf[1] for ironic does not set the mtu option. We should add it to dnsmasq_ip_subnets[2] and ensure it's set here[3] to the value of local_mtu on the undercloud. We may also want to add per-subnet mtu setting undercloud.conf[4].

btw, Are you setting local_mtu in undercloud.conf? (I would have guesses dnsmasq would automatically provide the mtu option with a value matching the interfare, but maby my hopes are too high.)

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic/src/branch/master/templates/inspector_dnsmasq_http.erb
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic/src/branch/master/manifests/inspector.pp#L144
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/src/branch/master/tripleoclient/v1/undercloud_config.py#L215'
[4] https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/src/branch/master/tripleoclient/config/undercloud.py#L357-L427"}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-09-26 11:16:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-09-26 11:24:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I still think we should fix this in puppet-ironic + tripleo instead.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-09-26 11:35:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

I strongly suspect Harald is correct here. Just keeping this patch up to date while I rebase stuff.

That said, it's impossible to deploy with OVB today on upshift, at least, and this hack makes it work and shouldn't hurt anybody badly. If it looks like patching those other things might be hard or take a while, it might be worth taking this patch in the meantime so folks (I'm thinking of me ;)) can get work done today. This should be accompanied with a comment to remove the hack once specifically referenced bugs are fixed."}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-09-26 11:40:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-09-26 11:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-09-26 11:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I opened bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-ironic/+bug/1845487 and started working on the patch for puppet-ironic.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-09-26 17:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-09-26 17:03:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I've rethought this. Even though it looks like Harald has a proper fix and it may land quickly, that's not going to help me deploying OSP13 any time soon. I think we should land the hack anyway.

That said, I should probably think about whether we can detect if we were given an MTU explicitly or not, and only default it to 1350 if we weren't given one explicitly."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-09-26 18:12:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> That said, I should probably think about whether we can detect if we were given an MTU explicitly or not, and only default it to 1350 if we weren't given one explicitly.

Well, if DHCP gives out a value then it will be an option so it should be possible to see if the option is set or not (or you may already have it done here, I dunno)."}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-09-30 08:51:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-10-08 09:47:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

FWIW, I tested the image built by this change and it worked fine.* I'm also good with forcing the MTU to a safe value here. It's unlikely to cause any major issues and it will avoid tough to debug problems.

*: Which means the rest of the patches in this series are also good as far as I'm concerned. I'm not going to go through and test each one individually."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2020-03-10 11:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Explicitly set MTU on interfaces in IPXE image

IPXE boot frequently hangs during introspection on upshift downloading
agent.kernel and/or agent.ramdisk because our virtualised network has a
smaller MTU than the default of 1500, and the introspection dhcp server
doesn't provide it explicitly. This is a hack to work round this until a
proper fix lands for bug 1845487, and it's backported everywhere we need
it. We should eventually aim to revert it.

Related-Bug: 1845487

Change-Id: I5efeaba8f4184c4a51575a3fb29804fd744d13b9

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I0d2b84e2ed627481118151b36386014ed0930452
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Now that we are python3 only, we should move to using the built
in version of mock that supports all of our testing needs and
remove the dependency on the "mock" package.

This patch moves all references to "import mock" to

Change-Id: Id881071803e580c10ca3ff33689d01b8b305b3e8

commit_message:
Remove the dependency on the "mock" package

Now that we are python3 only, we should move to using the built
in version of mock that supports all of our testing needs and
remove the dependency on the "mock" package.

This patch moves all references to "import mock" to
"from unittest import mock". It also cleans up some new line
inconsistency.

Change-Id: Id881071803e580c10ca3ff33689d01b8b305b3e8

commit_message:
update requirements to support older releases

while python 2.7 support is nolonger required,
as this is a tempest plugin its possible desireable
to be able to run it on older releases.

This change caps the version of sshtunnel used on
python 2.7 to avoid a depency on cryptography 2.6
which is not avaliable on rhel 7 for downstream testing.

In the future we might want to consider if we drop
support for python 2.7 on the master branch and have a
seperate branch for 2.7 suport.

this change also removes py35 form the default tox envs
and update the tox config to skip missing interpreters and
ignore base python version conflict to allow pyXX envs
to work correctly.

Change-Id: I2726619df5752cd8478918346280244a8828c56c

commit_message:
Fix network policy job

This patch set addresses an issue with the placement component of nova
breaking the network policy job.

Also, make the network policy jobs voting to ensure things do not break.

Change-Id: I41dfa6a335a915dbaf08114c2e14e906c76e85ba
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Updated relevant methods with namespace field for mistral

mistral supports namespace for, workbooks and workflows, updated
utils.py for mistral and added a new method ('create_workflow')
for creating workflows not in a workbook.

Change-Id: Icb9ac70486e506e658b875a54ce4db479b089ef2
Depends-On: Ia225e3735db9de029a1992c5db60f38e8f8124a0

commit_message:
Partial revert for c8 migration

This change is a partial revert of I18dfce4ef4d8c3bd3b73b2447fc6807047186f61.
While we need to migrate everything to CentOS 8 going forward, we're not able
to reliably do that at this time without making these tests non-voting. This
is being done because these roles are crucial to our success and we need them
to remain voting.

Partial-Bug: 1867787
Change-Id: I2bdc5c703dc104341e3e43fa3019e9b556d3c520

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-27 13:46:43.000000000', 'message': "Support DPDK application on bare-metal host

This patch contains binding driver, which intend to copy vhostuser port to
containers's directory. Here container's directory it's mounted directory.
Also this patch contains code to create proper VIF in case when neutron ovs
agent configured to work with vhostuser ports.

There is no code here for port creation, due to it performs in
base.connect by os_vif.plug. This function creates/or recreates OVS bridge
with netdev type, then it  creates port in this bridge. It uses vif.network.bridge
as the name for integration bridge, IOW it doesn't use ovs_bridge from kuryr.conf,
vif.network.bridge is configured by neutron ovs agent.

VhostUser mode is defined by neutron ovs agent, it obtains from
Open vSwitch configuration:

Command to check Open vSwitch configuration

ovs-vsctl list Open_vSwitch |grep iface_types

If neutron ovs agent found dpdkvhostuserclient there, it sets vhostuser_mode
to VIFVHostUserMode.SERVER, it means DPDK application in container will be
a server, and OVS will be a client, so DPDK application will create/bind/listen
vhostuser socket by predefined path. This path is set to vhostuser_mount_point.
When dpdkvhostuserclient is not in OVS's capability list, e.g. it's old
OVS or it was built w/o dpdkvhostuserclient support, the mode will be
 VIFVHostUserMode.CLIENT. In this case OVS will create/bind/listen socket,
so socket file will exist, and it shoud be copied to container's mount volume.
At the moment of copying OVS server already has to listen it, otherwise
approach is not working.

Change-Id: Ib9c22368e518815064282f4c3b9f9ddaf58dc622
Signed-off-by: Alexey Perevalov <a.perevalov@samsung.com>

"}, {'created': '2020-03-05 13:54:32.000000000', 'message': 'Autogenerate path for vhostuserclient socket

Before this patch path to a vhostuserclient socket was hardcodeed in a
kuryr-kubernetes config file. So every new created port was using the
same path. That leaded to a socket-file conflict when more than one
container was intended to use a DPDK-enabled port.

This patch automatically concatenates portname to a socket directory
path, so every port gets a unique vhost-server-path like
"/var/run/vhostuser/vhua5a8d6c0-41"

Change-Id: I9112365585466a126e2653f25aea71ff473c86b8
Signed-off-by: Andrey Zaikin <a.zaikin@partner.samsung.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-03-05 14:05:28.000000000', 'message': "Support DPDK application on bare-metal host

directory. Also this patch contains code to create proper VIF in case
when neutron ovs agent configured to work with vhostuser ports.

There is no code here for port creation, due to it performs in
base.connect by os_vif.plug. This function creates/or recreates OVS
bridge with netdev type, then it  creates port in this bridge. It uses
vif.network.bridge as the name for integration bridge, IOW it doesn't
use ovs_bridge from kuryr.conf, vif.network.bridge is configured by
neutron ovs agent.

VhostUser mode is defined by neutron ovs agent, it obtains from
Open vSwitch configuration:

Command to check Open vSwitch configuration

ovs-vsctl list Open_vSwitch |grep iface_types

If neutron ovs agent finds dpdkvhostuserclient there, it sets
vhostuser_mode to VIFVHostUserMode.SERVER, it means DPDK application in
container will be a server, and OVS will be a client, so DPDK
application will create/bind/listen vhostuser socket by predefined path.
This path is set in kuryr.conf/vhostuser/mount_point.
When dpdkvhostuserclient is not in OVS's capability list, e.g. it's old
OVS or it was built w/o dpdkvhostuserclient support, the mode will be
VIFVHostUserMode.CLIENT. In this case OVS will create/bind/listen
socket, so socket file will exist, and it shoud be copied to container's
mount volume. At the moment of copying OVS server already has to listen
it, otherwise approach is not working.

Partially Implements: blueprint support-vhost-user-port-type-on-bm-installation

Based on commit c32f505 of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/596731/

Change-Id: Ib9c22368e518815064282f4c3b9f9ddaf58dc622
Signed-off-by: Alexey Perevalov <a.perevalov@samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Andrey Zaikin <a.zaikin@partner.samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Vladimir Kuramshin <v.kuramshin@samsung.com>

when neutron ovs agent configured to work with vhostuser ports.

There is no code here for port creation, due to it performs in
base.connect by os_vif.plug. This function creates/or recreates OVS
bridge with netdev type, then it  creates port in this bridge. It uses
vif.network.bridge as the name for integration bridge, IOW it doesn't
use ovs_bridge from kuryr.conf, vif.network.bridge is configured by
neutron ovs agent.

VhostUser mode is defined by neutron ovs agent, it obtains from
Open vSwitch configuration:

Command to check Open vSwitch configuration

ovs-vsctl list Open_vSwitch |grep iface_types

If neutron ovs agent finds dpdkvhostuserclient there, it sets
vhostuser_mode to VIFVHostUserMode.SERVER, it means DPDK application in
container will be a server, and OVS will be a client, so DPDK
application will create/bind/listen vhostuser socket by predefined path.
This path is set in kuryr.conf/vhostuser/mount_point.
When dpdkvhostuserclient is not in OVS's capability list, e.g. it's old
OVS or it was built w/o dpdkvhostuserclient support, the mode will be
VIFVHostUserMode.CLIENT. In this case OVS will create/bind/listen
socket, so socket file will exist, and it shoud be copied to container's
mount volume. At the moment of copying OVS server already has to listen
it, otherwise approach is not working.

Partially Implements: blueprint support-vhost-user-port-type-on-bm-installation

Change-Id: Ib9c22368e518815064282f4c3b9f9ddaf58dc622
Signed-off-by: Alexey Perevalov <a.perevalov@samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Andrey Zaikin <a.zaikin@partner.samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Vladimir Kuramshin <v.kuramshin@samsung.com>

VIFVHostUserMode.CLIENT. In this case OVS will create/bind/listen
socket, so socket file will exist, and it shoud be copied to container's
mount volume. At the moment of copying OVS server already has to listen

Partially Implements: blueprint support-vhost-user-port-type-on-bm-installation

Signed-off-by: Vladimir Kuramshin <v.kuramshin@samsung.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Support DPDK application on bare-metal host

This patch contains binding driver, which intend to copy vhostuser port
to containers's directory. Here container's directory it's mounted
directory. Also this patch contains code to create proper VIF in case
when neutron ovs agent configured to work with vhostuser ports.

There is no code here for port creation, due to it performs in
base.connect by os_vif.plug. This function creates/or recreates OVS
bridge with netdev type, then it  creates port in this bridge. It uses
vif.network.bridge as the name for integration bridge, IOW it doesn't
use ovs_bridge from kuryr.conf, vif.network.bridge is configured by
neutron ovs agent.

VhostUser mode is defined by neutron ovs agent, it obtains from
Open vSwitch configuration:

Command to check Open vSwitch configuration

ovs-vsctl list Open_vSwitch |grep iface_types

If neutron ovs agent finds dpdkvhostuserclient there, it sets
vhostuser_mode to VIFVHostUserMode.SERVER, it means DPDK application in
container will be a server, and OVS will be a client, so DPDK
application will create/bind/listen vhostuser socket by predefined path.
This path is set in kuryr.conf/vhostuser/mount_point.
When dpdkvhostuserclient is not in OVS's capability list, e.g. it's old
OVS or it was built w/o dpdkvhostuserclient support, the mode will be
VIFVHostUserMode.CLIENT. In this case OVS will create/bind/listen
socket, so socket file will exist, and it shoud be copied to container's
mount volume. At the moment of copying OVS server already has to listen
it, otherwise approach is not working.

Partially Implements: blueprint support-vhost-user-port-type-on-bm-installation

Change-Id: Ib9c22368e518815064282f4c3b9f9ddaf58dc622
Signed-off-by: Alexey Perevalov <a.perevalov@samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Andrey Zaikin <a.zaikin@partner.samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Vladimir Kuramshin <v.kuramshin@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Microversion 2.82 - nova cyborg interaction

This patch adds support for microversion 2.82
"Define Cyborg ARQ binding notification event" (*).

*: I7a626544d8221dc0eeb5672986ca897ce4718be8

No changes are required in the novaclient side,
so just increment the microversion.

Change-Id: I3a8a2f8b5ced5519082f0b7609702d4f62be88ac
Implements: blueprint nova-cyborg-interaction

[{'account_id': 30777, 'date': '2020-02-06 06:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30777, 'date': '2020-02-06 06:16:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30777, 'date': '2020-02-10 19:32:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30777, 'date': '2020-02-10 19:53:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2020-02-10 21:13:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This along with the ability to inject secret variables via the values.yaml file should accomplish this in a less convoluted manner'}, {'account_id': 30777, 'date': '2020-03-17 15:04:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Reinventing the wheel'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-06 06:11:00.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] HTK Dynamic Endpoint Auth Secrets

I'd like a mechanism to dynamically provide endpoint auth
credentials to applications. Fluentd for instance, can be
configured to forward logs to multiple destinations. If
these require authentication it would be convenient if their
credentials could be stored in secret automagically.

Currently deployment-fluentd.yaml hardcodes elasticsearch
secret references, while kafka can added by a toggle, and
both applications have separate secret documents. This isn't
all that flexible - if another log destination is desired
then more documents must be created, and the deployment yaml
updated.

This change introduces two helm toolkit snippets:
- One to create a single secret document based on .Values.endpoints
- One to produce corresponding environment variables for pods.

This change hasn't been tested yet and is likely broken. :)

Feedback is welcome!

Change-Id: I65e1871ceba6920a6775563a2c1099b71a5fc559

commit_message:
Helm-ToolKit Dynamic Endpoint Auth Secrets

I'd like a mechanism to dynamically provide endpoint auth
credentials to applications. Fluentd for instance, can be
configured to forward logs to multiple destinations. If
these require authentication it would be convenient if their
credentials could be stored in secret automagically.

Currently deployment-fluentd.yaml hardcodes elasticsearch
secret references, while kafka can added by a toggle, and
both applications have separate secret documents. This isn't
all that flexible - if another log destination is desired
then more documents must be created, and the deployment yaml
updated.

This change introduces two helm toolkit snippets:
- One to create a single secret document based on .Values.endpoints
- One to produce corresponding environment variables for pods.

Change-Id: I65e1871ceba6920a6775563a2c1099b71a5fc559

[{'created': '2020-01-16 20:39:58.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify fitting hugepages log message

Currently, when fitting an instance with hugepages to a host, if the
host NUMA cell does not have enough free pages of the requested size,
the message that is logged is about not supporting the page size at
all. This is not correct. This patch changes the error message to
mention the possibility that there are not enough free pages of the
requested size on the host.

Change-Id: Ifcba63b654fcdce279e93f3b726aff09a48807ed
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify fitting hugepages log message

Currently, when fitting an instance with hugepages to a host, if the
host NUMA cell does not have enough free pages of the requested size,
the message that is logged is about not supporting the page size at
all. This is not correct. This patch changes the error message to
mention the possibility that there are not enough free pages of the
requested size on the host.

Change-Id: Ifcba63b654fcdce279e93f3b726aff09a48807ed

Tried that earlier, no luck. It's busted - permission denied accessing fernet keys.

https://35cdbd1bf8d73b8d44a8-11435350b95a5eeaa7fca236b28fcfc7.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/712112/8/check/bifrost-integration-tinyipa-keystone-ubuntu-bionic/720498b/logs/all/syslog

commit_message:
Fix Ubuntu keystone deployment

No package python3-setuputils available. Should probably be
python3-setuptools.

Version checking for fernet was failing - version now sent to stdout,
not stderr. UUID tokens are long gone - always use fernet.

Change-Id: I9703570695ccf1fc3e767c95629c51b5e7e8de83

commit_message:
Add focal-ussuri and bionic-ussuri bundle

This patch adds a focal-ussuri and bionic-ussuri bundles to the tests
for the charm.  Note that this requires a modified zaza (to use the
force_deploy option).

The patchset includes a charm-helpers sync to bring in Py3.8 compatible
charm-helpers for focal support.

It also requires Py3.8 compatible versions of hacluster and glance
charms.  See:

 - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711616/ - charm-glance
 - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711617/ - charm-hacluster

Change-Id: I78569b8c51626177164084e4d1f5e18d40f4c3d8

commit_message:
placement: Remove Nova to Placement extraction step

This step was introduced in the initial extraction of Placement from
Nova during the Stein cycle but only used with the extraction of the
service in TripleO during Train. We can now drop this in Ussuri.

Change-Id: Ic0e8217fe0bf650e042bcaaa1e1d8f730635be70

commit_message:
Do not try to refresh vips on OVN LB that will be deleted

When there are multiple listeners with different protocols
configured on OVN LB, and one of listeners needs to be deleted,
there is no need to refresh vips on given OVN LB.
If there are no listners withing same protocol left the given OVN
LB could be deleted and there is no need to refresh vips then.

Change-Id: If15f817617facade10005878c8dfc7f467ce75a9
Closes-Bug: 1866087

commit_message:
Remove use of admin_token for Keystone V2.0 deployments

At present the charm configures the Ceph RADOS GW with the
admin_token as credentials when connecting to a deployment with
Keystone V2.0 API.

We want to move away from that and as such we need to update the
charm to configure username, password and project name instead.

Change-Id: Idab6a5740a541b922f9dbd65165d0328d747e78e

when built on CentOS 8.

commit_message:
Add separate policies for updating node instance_info and extra

In order to provision a node using standalone Ironic, a user must
be able to update a few additional node attributes. However, we
would not want a lessee user to be able to update every node
attribute. This change allows an Ironic administrator to provide
policy-based access to updating instance_info and extra.

Change-Id: I43c22027116da1e057972dbe853403c16e965fc9
Story: #2006506
Task: #38748

commit_message:
CI: Change ceph-ansible docker tag to latest-nautilus

ceph-ansible by default uses "latest" tag for ceph Docker Hub images,
but recently latest tag has been upgraded to be Octopus release,
not Nautilus.

Change-Id: I5247c10079ab91cce130cd5ba403f25ccaf7c1fb

commit_message:
Add CephBasePoolVars and CephKeyVars structures

This patch introduces CephBasePoolVars and CephKeyVars
structures which are used to handle the pool and keys
related ceph variables.
This change also sets the tripleo-ansible facts needed
to move the logic of building 'openstack_pools' and
'openstack_keys' arrays in tripleo-ansible.
The resulting structures will be merged/combined then
with the main 'ceph_ansible_group_vars_all' (all.yaml)
provided by ceph-base.

Closes-Bug: #1864477
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/713106
Change-Id: Ic241d8fe9e09075fadd1f96b329e8a5c9eb0a9ff
(cherry picked from commit a9b8087db1892236e1df9e76d7f4bac4ba6ea844)

subject: Flatten volume from glance rbd image
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 9236, 'name': 'Jon Bernard', 'email': 'jobernar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jbernard'}, {'_account_id': 9535, 'name': 'Gorka Eguileor', 'email': 'geguileo@redhat.com', 'username': 'Gorka'}, {'_account_id': 10420, 'name': 'Adrian Turjak', 'email': 'devs+openstack@uncaught-exceptions.com', 'username': 'adriant'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 15961, 'name': 'lisali', 'email': 'xiaoyan.li@intel.com', 'username': 'lisali'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27615, 'name': 'Rajat Dhasmana', 'email': 'rajatdhasmana@gmail.com', 'username': 'whoami-rajat'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-11-08 09:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-11-08 14:07:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-12-17 22:25:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Would like to get input from one of the Red Hat folks on this.

This states the problem well enough, but it doesn't really explain what the flatten call does. I'm assuming that breaks the dependency between the new volume and the original image, but it would be great if this explained a little why we need to add this call and what specifically that call ends up doing."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2019-01-08 20:39:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I think this makes sense to me as a change.'}, {'account_id': 9236, 'date': '2019-01-09 02:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Why would you want to remove the dependency?'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-01-09 19:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)

Thanks for continuing this. Kindly address all the comments of the previous patch here.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-01-23 16:48:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-02-21 16:18:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

Not valid for Stein at this point, the spec also needs some real work for the next release since it doesn't adequately explain the reasoning or use case here."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-05-27 02:30:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd like to add that this is something we would definitely want to use.

Most of our ceph image/volumes/snapshots are copy on write, and that means we have a dependency chain from whatever the first item may have been.
E.g: Make volume1 from image, make snapshot1 from volume1, make volume2 from snapshot1, can't now delete volume1 or snapshot1 since volume2 and snapshot1 depend on it.

This means that we have customers who keep a lot of awkward volumes and snapshots around because they can't delete them. If they could have an API in cinder and glance which allows them to flatten volumes,snapshots, and images and break the connections, that would be really useful."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-05-29 15:41:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> This means that we have customers who keep a lot of awkward volumes and snapshots around because they can't delete them. If they could have an API in cinder and glance which allows them to flatten volumes,snapshots, and images and break the connections, that would be really useful.

This sounds like a bug that should be fixed by changes like 
    https://review.opendev.org/#/c/281550/

rather than the approach suggested here.

I suspect what you really want is for the Ceph driver to handle these snapshots correctly behind the scenes, not to impose flattening operations that would really hurt performance."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-05-30 01:35:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> This sounds like a bug that should be fixed by changes like
 > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/281550/
 > 
 > rather than the approach suggested here.
 > 
 > I suspect what you really want is for the Ceph driver to handle
 > these snapshots correctly behind the scenes, not to impose
 > flattening operations that would really hurt performance.

Sort of. The issue isn't the snapshots, but wanting to delete the original volumes that the snapshots are based on, and maybe the snapshots themselves, and just keep the new volume made from it.

Fixing it in ceph isn't exactly doable since these are copy on write, so ceph needs the previous volume/snapshot/image and only flattening one of the end nodes actually allows breaking the dependencies."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-12-09 20:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No action in over 6 months.  Feel free to reopen if this is still relevant.'}, {'account_id': 29482, 'date': '2020-03-17 13:31:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi all, 

what about "rbd_flatten_volume_from_image" ?

When can we have this Option in Stable Release Code ?

At moment we are using Workaround "rbd –p volumes flatten volume-xxxxxx"  for all Volume created from Glance-Images.'}]

[{'created': '2018-11-08 09:51:59.000000000', 'message': "Flatten volume from glance rbd image

Suppose glance and cinder uses ceph rbd driver as storage backend,
cinder and glance are in the same ceph storage cluster.

If cinder creates a volume from an image, it could create a clone volume
from that image, and the relationship is 'glance image-->rbd snap of
glance image-->clone image(=volume from image)' like below.

rbd image 'volume-ac1cc55d-ba36-42c6-b533-4b5e71ffd1e2':
    size 20480 MB in 5120 objects
    order 22 (4096 kB objects)
    block_name_prefix: rbd_data.e0a167539c874
    format: 2
    features: layering, exclusive-lock, deep-flatten
    flags:
    parent: glance-images/8954bdf3-8ad7-4fff-be79-a3dd62a341d0@snap
    overlap: 2252 MB

If we want to remove the dependencies between glance image and
cinder volume, we should flatten the clone image.

So it’s necessary to add a config option named
rbd_flatten_volume_from_image to decide whether to flatten
rbd clone image or not.
And it is also necessary to call _flatten in clone_image method.
cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py

Change-Id: I1beeb3b77cdd05e99b425d1d68e2c68319e53fe1
Implements: blueprint flatten-volume-from-image
"}, {'created': '2018-11-08 14:07:33.000000000', 'message': "Flatten volume from glance rbd image

commit_message:
Flatten volume from glance rbd image

Suppose glance and cinder uses ceph rbd driver as storage backend,
cinder and glance are in the same ceph storage cluster.

If cinder creates a volume from an image, it could create a clone volume
from that image, and the relationship is 'glance image-->rbd snap of
glance image-->clone image(=volume from image)' like below.

rbd image 'volume-ac1cc55d-ba36-42c6-b533-4b5e71ffd1e2':
    size 20480 MB in 5120 objects
    order 22 (4096 kB objects)
    block_name_prefix: rbd_data.e0a167539c874
    format: 2
    features: layering, exclusive-lock, deep-flatten
    flags:
    parent: glance-images/8954bdf3-8ad7-4fff-be79-a3dd62a341d0@snap
    overlap: 2252 MB

If we want to remove the dependencies between glance image and
cinder volume, we should flatten the clone image.

So it’s necessary to add a config option named
rbd_flatten_volume_from_image to decide whether to flatten
rbd clone image or not.
And it is also necessary to call _flatten in clone_image method.
cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py

Change-Id: I1beeb3b77cdd05e99b425d1d68e2c68319e53fe1
Implements: blueprint flatten-volume-from-image

[{'created': '2020-03-10 16:20:35.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure DIB is installed from source

Bifrost clones the DIB repo and installs it. However, after running
install.yaml pip freeze shows diskimage-builder 2.33 is installed.

This is caused by the recent addition of IPA builder, which has its own
dependency on diskimage-builder.

This change fixes the issue by swapping the order of installation of IPA
builder and DIB, to ensure DIB is installed last.

Change-Id: Ifd67adaa98e920f42c80d239349ae61d7d610f66
Story: 2007401
Task: 38999
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure DIB is installed from source

Bifrost clones the DIB repo and installs it. However, after running
install.yaml pip freeze shows diskimage-builder 2.33 is installed.

This is caused by the recent addition of IPA builder, which has its own
dependency on diskimage-builder.

This change fixes the issue by swapping the order of installation of IPA
builder and DIB, to ensure DIB is installed last.

Change-Id: Ifd67adaa98e920f42c80d239349ae61d7d610f66
Story: 2007401
Task: 38999

commit_message:
cleanup fluentd overrides

As a followup for patch I3a5a5ed0defe8ce0259e5c09eaec11814fd51054
* fluentd and hostname are already in the packages list in kolla
* Also remove the dev packages for installing gem packages from tarball
* move the fluentd_plugin_install block override up
  to make it easier to track what is going on

Change-Id: Ib13719b9e923a472127d509c57adfffd505d61f7

(6 comments)

This is pretty awesome. I have some questions and comments inline.

My main concern with this piece is upgrade strategy. Switch from cluster-scoped CRDs to namespaced is impossible in K8s:

 stack@devstack:~$ kubectl apply -f kn.yaml
 The CustomResourceDefinition "kuryrnets.openstack.org" is invalid: spec.scope: Invalid value: "Namespaced": field is immutable

The feasible way to tackle this might be to create a totally new CRD, e.g. KuryrNetwork and have code migrating that on service startup. Fortunately old version of the CRDs is basically immutable.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2020-02-28 17:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

commit_message:
Namespace event handling through KuryrNet CRD

This patch moves the namespace handling to be more aligned
with the k8s style.

Depends-on: If0aaf748d13027b3d660aa0f74c4f6653e911250

commit_message:
Baremetal Configure Playbook

This playbook replaces the Mistral functionality used by the `openstack
baremetal node configure` CLI command.

A module to support using methods from tripleo-common has been created.

Related-Bug: #1835230
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691717/
Change-Id: I372aa52928a5aa000b619e6cde72bdbd5b086330
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-11 16:56:11.000000000', 'message': 'Use jinja raw tag instead of quoted concatenation

Many of the lines are difficult to grasp due to the crazy
quotation and concatenation implemented to get the desired
result from generating playbooks via a jinja template.

We can make it easier to read and easier to understand by
using the jinja raw tag instead. This eases the maintenace
burden on us all and helps us sleep better at night.

Change-Id: I82c4de4a63817707a2b0ed0ced827be37c0d0463
'}, {'created': '2020-03-12 10:05:54.000000000', 'message': 'Use jinja raw tag instead of quoted concatenation

Many of the lines are difficult to grasp due to the crazy
quotation and concatenation implemented to get the desired
result from generating playbooks via a jinja template.

We can make it easier to read and easier to understand by

commit_message:
Use jinja raw tag instead of quoted concatenation

Many of the lines are difficult to grasp due to the crazy
quotation and concatenation implemented to get the desired
result from generating playbooks via a jinja template.

We can make it easier to read and easier to understand by
using the jinja raw tag instead. This eases the maintenace
burden on us all and helps us sleep better at night.

Change-Id: I82c4de4a63817707a2b0ed0ced827be37c0d0463

commit_message:
Drop rootwrap.d/ironic-lib.filters file

The file is included in the ironic-lib module and there is no
difference (beside some comments) in the files.

For packagers, this solves the problem that ironic-lib and ironic are
currently not installable together given that both packages contain
the same file.

Story: 2006604
Task: 36772
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/684771
Change-Id: I2d800d4c2616ccd9d9f12a2fe59e259def15dc6b

commit_message:
[DNM] Check new zaqar-tempest-plugin tests

CentOS7 poi jobs are failing[1] after new test[2]
added in zaqar-tempest-plugin, check if those are
detected in zaqar patches.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-openstack-integration/+bug/1863560

[{'created': '2020-03-17 09:49:29.000000000', 'message': "os-xenapi: use stestr instead of os-testr, disable doc build

All OpenStack projects have migrated from os-testr to stestr, and
os-xenapi is a notable exception. We can use stestr anyway to run
unit tests, removing the need for os-testr as a build requirement.

Also, os-xenapi still requires oslosphinx to build its
documentation. Let's disable doc builds, since this package is not
in Ussuri for the SUSE CI.

Change-Id: I1e947af2da0c1f81b4c9ab186cb8afa04d427e4e
(cherry picked from commit 5ae343cd0421798bc1575208c6c7bb9bdf89ec8f)
"}]
commit_message:
os-xenapi: use stestr instead of os-testr, disable doc build

All OpenStack projects have migrated from os-testr to stestr, and
os-xenapi is a notable exception. We can use stestr anyway to run
unit tests, removing the need for os-testr as a build requirement.

Also, os-xenapi still requires oslosphinx to build its
documentation. Let's disable doc builds, since this package is not
in Ussuri for the SUSE CI.

Change-Id: I1e947af2da0c1f81b4c9ab186cb8afa04d427e4e
(cherry picked from commit 5ae343cd0421798bc1575208c6c7bb9bdf89ec8f)

of new jobs for arm64. When it is ready, I will revert the code**

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-16 14:29:57.000000000', 'message': "CI: Don't fail on expected critical log messages

There is a number of critical log messages that we see in CI from time
to time. While these should be fixed, let's not fail jobs unnecessarily.

This change introduces one expected critical message in
placement-api.log:

    Failed to fetch token data from identity server

Co-authored-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Related-bug: #1847727
Change-Id: I92ad0be70ed05925612f0c709907ab62280326b8
(cherry picked from commit 2f7640d3965118a522b5fb18e66d5455ae132b87)
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Don't fail on expected critical log messages

There is a number of critical log messages that we see in CI from time
to time. While these should be fixed, let's not fail jobs unnecessarily.

This change introduces one expected critical message in
placement-api.log:

    Failed to fetch token data from identity server

Co-authored-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Related-bug: #1847727
Change-Id: I92ad0be70ed05925612f0c709907ab62280326b8
(cherry picked from commit 2f7640d3965118a522b5fb18e66d5455ae132b87)

Agree remove this driver, as talked on irc, vmware ci havent's worked in a couple of years."}, {'account_id': 20322, 'date': '2020-03-11 03:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I do not Agree to  remove this driver, VMware will continue to provide technical support or update on the vmware driver.   Contact: xuel@vmware.com'}, {'account_id': 31702, 'date': '2020-03-11 03:18:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Hi,

I'm from the vmware openstack team. We are still keep working on vmwareapi driver(Code change, CI test). Please do not merge this patch. We will post changes and  trigger CI test later."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2020-03-11 12:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-03-11 14:41:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

The vmware driver needs somebody to maintain it and needs a CI machinery that test changes against a the vmware driver. For couple of releases we don't have that. So I think it is fair to deprecate the driver. If maintainers and CI machinery shows up then I'm totally OK to un-deprecate the driver."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-03-11 14:45:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I encourage everybody who voted -1 to reach out to VMware and ask for upstream support for their driver in nova.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2020-03-11 14:52:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I do not Agree to  remove this driver, VMware will continue to
 > provide technical support or update on the vmware driver.  
 > Contact: xuel@vmware.com

As gibi said, this patch doesn't remove the driver. It sets a deprecation warning that the driver is unmaintained, because it is and that's been the case pretty much for the better part of the last several years (see the various posts to the mailing list about the CI not working over the years). So IMO it is totally fair to warn as such and if the maintainers/CI shows up we can revert this once we're confident in that effort. Until then, this gives potential consumers an awareness about the true state of the driver as it is *today*."}, {'account_id': 31702, 'date': '2020-03-11 15:43:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-03-11 16:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-03-11 21:14:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I've got a frustrated (effectively non-)user of this driver E-mailing me and other OpenStack staff asking for help after sending multiple requests to the openstack-discuss mailing list and getting no response at all. Since VMware doesn't seem active in the community any longer I'm not sure who to even suggest they reach out to. If we have no reason to believe this driver is working any longer, it's better that we declare that clearly."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-03-11 21:19:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

[...]
> E-mailing me and other OpenStack staff
[...]

That should have said OpenStack Foundation staff, sorry.

> I'm not sure who to even suggest they reach out to.
[...]

After going over earlier review comments for this change I see that xuel@vmware.com has personally offered to field questions about the driver, so I will suggest the user reach out to that address."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-03-11 21:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I think the deprecation message is appropriate given the lack of a working CI for a sustained period of time and the lack of community support for end users coming to the ML with questions.

We can always un-deprecate the driver if the CI is rebuilt and if there are volunteer(s) to field community questions from users.'}, {'account_id': 31706, 'date': '2020-03-12 04:02:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

There was some issue with VMware CI and the team is working to rebuilt it. I think it will be recovered soon.
Now Lichao(xuel@vmware.com) and I (yingjisun@vmware.com) took over nova stuffs in VIO team. We are glad to continue contributing to nova. As we may have missed some discussions in openstack-discuss@lists.openstack.org, could you please send the questions to us if necessary.
We also have some fixes of nova driver on python3 and vSphere 7 compatibility issues to submit to upstream.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-03-12 10:53:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It's great to see clearly-identified people step up to properly maintain the driver. I hope the state of the driver and its CI can be improved enough before Ussuri release that the Nova team would feel comfortable reverting this deprecation warning before it gets in the final release.

But in the mean time, I agree that this accurately reflects the *current* state of the driver... so it feels OK to merge this today."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-03-12 13:34:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

Let's make the current state of the driver clear. I'm happy to revert this deprecation if the situation improves."}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2020-03-12 13:45:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Let's make the current state of the driver clear. I'm happy to
 > revert this deprecation if the situation improves.

We are working hard to fix our CI issue, and provide vmware driver support ASAP, thanks!"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2020-03-13 10:07:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've just been made aware of this by some people within vmware who are still involved (or at least hope to be). Based on the tacit policy set months or even years ago, I think this is the right step to make sure that users are aware of the maintenance situation with the driver.

I'm led to believe that there's hope/plans to fix the situation, but in the meantime the right and safe thing to do is continue with this."}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2020-03-17 10:55:52.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I98d11baa411cee7ec0b6ae25ef5a57f1cc979d7a'}]

commit_message:
Deprecate the vmwareapi driver

As of now, questions on the mailing list are going unanswered, and the
Nova team does not have a clear representative owner for the driver
to which bugs and other reports can be directed. There does not appear
to be a CI system running tests for the driver anymore, and the latest
indication from the community[1] points to it being potentially broken with
devstack.

This patch starts the deprecation timer for the driver and/or serves
as a flare to gauge interest (or lack thereof) in continuing to maintain
the driver.

1: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-March/013066.html

Change-Id: Ie39e9605dc8cebff3795a29ea91dc08ee64a21eb

commit_message:
Pin API microversions depending on upgrade type

When we do a FFU upgrade, we need to pin to use a
different set of API microversions than if we do
a standard major upgrade.

This implements a different pin depending on the
action.

Change-Id: I50270b65f0053ce8aa47cb469e93a38a30bcf4d3

commit_message:
Remove mock as a test requirement and add PyYAML as requirement.

Now that we have moved to py36 and later runtimes, we no longer
need to use the third party mock library and can only use the standard
library unittest.mock instead.

Change-Id: I97219a6b3ca2cff88b8871458466825e79736f77
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat-agents: fix shebangs

We need to make sure the python shebangs using "/usr/bin/env python"
are changed to "/usr/bin/python3", otherwise the build process will
fail on CentOS 8.

Change-Id: Ifb5c249788c2384bf70d25e7c3c947fbc347a984
(cherry picked from commit 8672c8b8795cd2b26216447f982ac5a9662d8812)

commit_message:
Add python2-requests back into skip removal.

When upgrading the Undercloud's operating system we need to
avoid the removal of python2-requests as that's a dependency
for leapp.

Change-Id: I6a0308bd504418fb8a92e8dbfd19786f9b92ff0f

commit_message:
Add needed parameters in containers-prepare-parameters for FFWD2.

We need to include few parameters in the containers-prepare-parameters.yaml
file to be able to perform the upgrade from Queens to Train, one set is the
ceph3_namespace parameters and the other one the Stein namespace ones. So
far they are being hardcoded in the parameters default, so it is possible
to override them if needed.

Change-Id: I4601e9d32ea3cd29a8f80189984e0259d3f29cf4

commit_message:
os-xenapi: use stestr instead of os-testr, disable doc build

All OpenStack projects have migrated from os-testr to stestr, and
os-xenapi is a notable exception. We can use stestr anyway to run
unit tests, removing the need for os-testr as a build requirement.

Also, os-xenapi still requires oslosphinx to build its
documentation. Let's disable doc builds, since this package is not
in Ussuri for the SUSE CI.

Change-Id: I1e947af2da0c1f81b4c9ab186cb8afa04d427e4e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-16 03:13:54.000000000', 'message': "address specific resources cleanup issue

Since we introduced objects.Instance.resources to store specific
resources and objects.MigrationContext.new/old_resources for
migration, which may need cleanup correctly based on instance obj
when destroy/cleanup invoked, we add parameter 'host' to driver
interface to tell if this cleanup/destroy is on source host or target
host. This will be useful when live migration rollback.

Besides, we set instance.host when apply/revert migration context,
always keeping them consistent, then we won't cleanup wrong resources.
Consider that an instance is deleted during migrating, the instance.host
is set to destination host but instance.resources is old_resoures on
source host. Then when destroy this deleted instance in periodic task
_cleanup_running_deleted_instances(), it will cleanup wrong resources,
such as vpmems, since these resources are claimed on source host.

Change-Id: Ida7fda578fc83909f204dc22d640f2c71df8245d
"}, {'created': '2019-12-16 06:20:59.000000000', 'message': "address specific resources cleanup issue

Consider that an instance is deleted during migrating, the instance.host
is set to destination host but instance.resources is old_resoures on

_cleanup_running_deleted_instances(), it will cleanup wrong resources,

Change-Id: Ida7fda578fc83909f204dc22d640f2c71df8245d

"}, {'created': '2019-12-25 09:10:11.000000000', 'message': "address specific resources cleanup issue

Since we introduced objects.Instance.resources to store specific
resources and objects.MigrationContext.new/old_resources for
migration, which may need cleanup correctly based on instance obj
when destroy/cleanup invoked, we add parameter 'host' to driver
interface to tell if this cleanup/destroy is on source host or target
host, and we introduce another driver interface cleanup_specific_resources
used to be called seperately. This will be useful to support live migration
with vpmem.

Besides, we set instance.host when apply/revert migration context,
always keeping them consistent, then we won't cleanup wrong resources.
Consider that an instance is deleted during migrating, the instance.host
is set to destination host but instance.resources is old_resoures on
source host. Then when destroy this deleted instance in periodic task
_cleanup_running_deleted_instances(), it will cleanup wrong resources,
such as vpmems, since these resources are claimed on source host.

Change-Id: Ida7fda578fc83909f204dc22d640f2c71df8245d
Implements: blueprint support-live-migration-with-virtual-persistent-memory
"}, {'created': '2020-02-18 12:41:46.000000000', 'message': "address specific resources cleanup issue

We introduced objects.Instance.resources to store specific resources, for an
instance in migrating, we have objects.MigrationContext.new/old_resources.
Until now we only treat vpmem as specific resources.

To address the cleanup issue, we add parameter 'host' to destroy and cleanup
interface to tell if this cleanup/destroy is on source host or target,
if 'host' is not set, we do cleanup based on objects.Instance.resources
by default. Also we will introduce another driver interface
cleanup_specific_resources used to be called seperately. This will be useful
to support live migration with vpmem.

Change-Id: Ida7fda578fc83909f204dc22d640f2c71df8245d
Implements: blueprint support-live-migration-with-virtual-persistent-memory

commit_message:
address specific resources cleanup issue

If an instance is in migrating, we store the new_resources and
old_resources in instance.migration_context.

To address the resource cleanup like vpmem during migration, we
modify the mutated_migration_context to temporarily apply/revert
the migration context, then we can use the temporary instance.resources
to do cleanup.

Change-Id: Ida7fda578fc83909f204dc22d640f2c71df8245d
Implements: blueprint support-live-migration-with-virtual-persistent-memory

subject: Bugfix: Set the appropriate status code for ServiceUnavailable

I think we shuold add a test case for this change.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2020-03-13 10:32:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > I think we shuold add a test case for this change.

Good Catch. Now We didn't have UT about get_sdk_adapter. After thinking about it, I'm not very good at the UT of this function. If it's just for testing this exception, I gave the relevant ones to mock (_get_conf_group, _get_auth_and_session, connection.Connection). But I don't think it makes much sense to write such a UT. When our cyborg later optimizes this UT, we can add this part of assert, what do you think? Or if you have time, could you add a UT about this function?"}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2020-03-17 02:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Brin. Do your forgot this patch? If you have time. Pls review again.'}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2020-03-17 03:09:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > mock (_get_conf_group, _get_auth_and_session, connection.Connection).
 > But I don't think it makes much sense to write such a UT. When our
 > cyborg later optimizes this UT, we can add this part of assert,
 > what do you think? Or if you have time, could you add a UT about
 > this function?

Agree that this patch probably doesn't need a test case.
If we want to check the exact results of this change through get_sdk_adapter, we need to at least add a testcase Class TestGetSDKAdapter() like this[0]. Adding unittest is always welcome and good for the code quality, but I personally think it's still safe for this change without a test. 
But then again, we should add TestGetSDKAdapter() in another patch.
