commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox and stop use pip.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value. Use the
right way when it's necessary.

Change-Id: I410173d5fdcd8c592d98eed2f48b98e06299e8b3

subject: Avoid multiple calls to create_ip_cert_links
messages: [{'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2020-03-16 12:02:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2020-03-16 14:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLGTM, thanks!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-16 12:02:26.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid multiple calls to create_ip_cert_links

Prior to this change, the call to create_ip_cert_links was inside the
for loop of tls objects. This caused LP Bug#1866741 where a sym link
with the same certificate name would get overwritten with a new cert.
This meant the last certificate of [internal, admin, public] would be
written to all three.

This change calls create_ip_cert_links and state sets only once. It also
adds a warning log entry if we accidentally overwrite sym linked files in
the future.

Change-Id: I4b36d7fd5e74ab3a894eb4a2451b5876fd777552
Partial-Bug: #1866741
(cherry picked from commit 72cfde8308684905363e80e4ca5db57f18573927)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid multiple calls to create_ip_cert_links

Prior to this change, the call to create_ip_cert_links was inside the
for loop of tls objects. This caused LP Bug#1866741 where a sym link
with the same certificate name would get overwritten with a new cert.
This meant the last certificate of [internal, admin, public] would be
written to all three.

This change calls create_ip_cert_links and state sets only once. It also
adds a warning log entry if we accidentally overwrite sym linked files in
the future.

Change-Id: I4b36d7fd5e74ab3a894eb4a2451b5876fd777552
Partial-Bug: #1866741
(cherry picked from commit 72cfde8308684905363e80e4ca5db57f18573927)

[{'created': '2019-12-05 14:23:12.000000000', 'message': "CI: Don't fail on exepected critical log messages

There are a number of critical log messages that we see in CI from time
to time. While these should be fixed, let's not fail jobs unnecessarily.

This change introduces one expected critical message in
placement-api.log:

    Failed to fetch token data from identity server

Change-Id: I92ad0be70ed05925612f0c709907ab62280326b8
"}, {'created': '2019-12-05 16:49:38.000000000', 'message': "CI: Don't fail on exepected critical log messages

There are a number of critical log messages that we see in CI from time
to time. While these should be fixed, let's not fail jobs unnecessarily.

commit_message:
CI: Don't fail on expected critical log messages

There is a number of critical log messages that we see in CI from time
to time. While these should be fixed, let's not fail jobs unnecessarily.

This change introduces one expected critical message in
placement-api.log:

    Failed to fetch token data from identity server

Co-authored-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Related-bug: #1847727
Change-Id: I92ad0be70ed05925612f0c709907ab62280326b8

commit_message:
Use a common playbook import for common plays

It would appear that we use many of the same plays in several
of the playbooks. In this patch we extract these into a common
playbook file so that we only need to repeat a single import
in each of the playbooks. This way we reduce the maintenance
burden because we only need to maintain it in one file.

Change-Id: Ib00e8aa9f7d06517290543a8aaf8a2527969bd3c
(cherry picked from commit 8e1171d01a9acfa63ecb8fdd7c30d4be3c034b01)

commit_message:
Finalize centos-8 migration

- assure all jobs are using centos-8
- fixed broken role-addition caused by partial centos-8 migration
- assure that touching molecule.yaml file tests role-addition, so
  we avoid future regressions

Change-Id: I18dfce4ef4d8c3bd3b73b2447fc6807047186f61

'}, {'created': '2020-03-04 13:21:30.000000000', 'message': "QoS - Increase size of tested file lineary with limit

Sometimes it is visible that first kilobytes of the
test file are downloaded a little bit faster than the
actual bw limit claims, especially while testing OVN
as a backend.
When it happens the avg bytes per second value that is
measured in the test could be higher than required limit.

It is pretty easy to show the case while testing QoS with iperf3:

Accepted connection from 172.24.5.1, port 59690
[  5] local 10.1.0.35 port 5201 connected to 172.24.5.1 port 59692
[ ID] Interval           Transfer     Bandwidth       Retr  Cwnd
[  5]   0.00-1.00   sec  1.32 MBytes  11.0 Mbits/sec  139   2.62 KBytes
[  5]   1.00-2.00   sec   628 KBytes  5.15 Mbits/sec   96   10.5 KBytes
[  5]   2.00-3.00   sec   502 KBytes  4.12 Mbits/sec   84   7.85 KBytes
[  5]   3.00-4.00   sec   649 KBytes  5.32 Mbits/sec   83   10.5 KBytes
[  5]   4.00-5.00   sec   643 KBytes  5.26 Mbits/sec   84   3.93 KBytes
[  5]   5.00-6.00   sec   529 KBytes  4.33 Mbits/sec   73   5.23 KBytes
[  5]   6.00-7.00   sec   628 KBytes  5.15 Mbits/sec   92   20.9 KBytes
[  5]   7.00-8.00   sec   534 KBytes  4.37 Mbits/sec   82   18.3 KBytes
[  5]   8.00-9.00   sec   667 KBytes  5.47 Mbits/sec  110   7.85 KBytes
[  5]   9.00-10.00  sec   635 KBytes  5.20 Mbits/sec   90   11.8 KBytes
[  5]  10.00-10.02  sec  0.00 Bytes  0.00 bits/sec    0   11.8 KBytes
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
[ ID] Interval           Transfer     Bandwidth       Retr
[  5]   0.00-10.02  sec  6.61 MBytes  5.53 Mbits/sec  933             sender
[  5]   0.00-10.02  sec  6.41 MBytes  5.36 Mbits/sec                  receiver
-----------------------------------------------------------

We can find out that during first second of the test the bw limit
is exceeded, but after that the traffic is shaped.

In our case when we run the tempest QoS test the avg bytes per second
measured value that we compair with bw limit is impacted.

To prevent tests to fail this patch increases the size of tested
file lineary with the tested bw_limit. It will help, because the
tested file shouldn't be downloaded within first second.

Closes-Bug: 1866039

Change-Id: I0964464e709baf9958548384933bd000fdee979b

"}, {'created': '2020-03-11 14:59:16.000000000', 'message': 'QoS - Change the way we measure bw limits

This patch introduces new way of fetching the data.
Instead creating the file, it reads /dev/zero.
/dev/zero is always very fast, so we also break the
previous hard disk limitations.

The test time is limited to 5 seconds. After that we
calculate avg bytes per second value and compare it
to expected one.

Sometimes it is visible that first kilobytes of the
test file are downloaded a little bit faster than the
actual bw limit claims, especially while testing OVN
as a backend.
When it happens the avg bytes per second value that is
measured in the test could be higher than required limit.

It is pretty easy to show the case while testing QoS with iperf3:

Accepted connection from 172.24.5.1, port 59690
[  5] local 10.1.0.35 port 5201 connected to 172.24.5.1 port 59692
[ ID] Interval           Transfer     Bandwidth       Retr  Cwnd
[  5]   0.00-1.00   sec  1.32 MBytes  11.0 Mbits/sec  139   2.62 KBytes
[  5]   1.00-2.00   sec   628 KBytes  5.15 Mbits/sec   96   10.5 KBytes
[  5]   2.00-3.00   sec   502 KBytes  4.12 Mbits/sec   84   7.85 KBytes
[  5]   3.00-4.00   sec   649 KBytes  5.32 Mbits/sec   83   10.5 KBytes
[  5]   4.00-5.00   sec   643 KBytes  5.26 Mbits/sec   84   3.93 KBytes
[  5]   5.00-6.00   sec   529 KBytes  4.33 Mbits/sec   73   5.23 KBytes
[  5]   6.00-7.00   sec   628 KBytes  5.15 Mbits/sec   92   20.9 KBytes
[  5]   7.00-8.00   sec   534 KBytes  4.37 Mbits/sec   82   18.3 KBytes
[  5]   8.00-9.00   sec   667 KBytes  5.47 Mbits/sec  110   7.85 KBytes
[  5]   9.00-10.00  sec   635 KBytes  5.20 Mbits/sec   90   11.8 KBytes
[  5]  10.00-10.02  sec  0.00 Bytes  0.00 bits/sec    0   11.8 KBytes
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
[ ID] Interval           Transfer     Bandwidth       Retr
[  5]   0.00-10.02  sec  6.61 MBytes  5.53 Mbits/sec  933             sender
[  5]   0.00-10.02  sec  6.41 MBytes  5.36 Mbits/sec                  receiver
-----------------------------------------------------------

We can find out that during first second of the test the bw limit
is exceeded, but after that the traffic is shaped.

In our case when we run the tempest QoS test the avg bytes per second
measured value that we compare with bw limit is impacted.

Closes-Bug: 1866039

Change-Id: I0964464e709baf9958548384933bd000fdee979b
'}]
commit_message:
QoS - Change the way we measure bw limits

This patch introduces new way of fetching the data.
Instead creating the file, it reads /dev/zero.
/dev/zero is always very fast, so we also break the
previous hard disk limitations.

The test time is limited to 5 seconds. After that we
calculate avg bytes per second value and compare it
to expected one.

Sometimes it is visible that first kilobytes of the
test file are downloaded a little bit faster than the
actual bw limit claims, especially while testing OVN
as a backend.
When it happens the avg bytes per second value that is
measured in the test could be higher than required limit.

It is pretty easy to show the case while testing QoS with iperf3:

Accepted connection from 172.24.5.1, port 59690
[  5] local 10.1.0.35 port 5201 connected to 172.24.5.1 port 59692
[ ID] Interval           Transfer     Bandwidth       Retr  Cwnd
[  5]   0.00-1.00   sec  1.32 MBytes  11.0 Mbits/sec  139   2.62 KBytes
[  5]   1.00-2.00   sec   628 KBytes  5.15 Mbits/sec   96   10.5 KBytes
[  5]   2.00-3.00   sec   502 KBytes  4.12 Mbits/sec   84   7.85 KBytes
[  5]   3.00-4.00   sec   649 KBytes  5.32 Mbits/sec   83   10.5 KBytes
[  5]   4.00-5.00   sec   643 KBytes  5.26 Mbits/sec   84   3.93 KBytes
[  5]   5.00-6.00   sec   529 KBytes  4.33 Mbits/sec   73   5.23 KBytes
[  5]   6.00-7.00   sec   628 KBytes  5.15 Mbits/sec   92   20.9 KBytes
[  5]   7.00-8.00   sec   534 KBytes  4.37 Mbits/sec   82   18.3 KBytes
[  5]   8.00-9.00   sec   667 KBytes  5.47 Mbits/sec  110   7.85 KBytes
[  5]   9.00-10.00  sec   635 KBytes  5.20 Mbits/sec   90   11.8 KBytes
[  5]  10.00-10.02  sec  0.00 Bytes  0.00 bits/sec    0   11.8 KBytes
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
[ ID] Interval           Transfer     Bandwidth       Retr
[  5]   0.00-10.02  sec  6.61 MBytes  5.53 Mbits/sec  933             sender
[  5]   0.00-10.02  sec  6.41 MBytes  5.36 Mbits/sec                  receiver
-----------------------------------------------------------

We can find out that during first second of the test the bw limit
is exceeded, but after that the traffic is shaped.

In our case when we run the tempest QoS test the avg bytes per second
measured value that we compare with bw limit is impacted.

Closes-Bug: 1866039

Change-Id: I0964464e709baf9958548384933bd000fdee979b

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that OpenStack has moved to py36 and later runtimes, we no longer
need to use the third party mock library and can use the standard
library unittest.mock instead.

Change-Id: I100001fd0615cb55cbdbabbf0c6aa41b1729569c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Do not rebuild existing images, but allow the children to be built
messages:
[{'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-01-28 10:49:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2020-01-28 10:54:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You know that when you say what you want to build you are giving regexp?

kolla-build openswitch == .*openswitch.* so openswitch-base is also built.

Maybe you want --skip-parents? Or exact list of images to build?'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-01-28 11:13:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We do it this way:

We build our base images in stage 1 (e.g. with openvswitch-base). This will build base + openvswitch-base.

In stage 2 we build required base images (e.g. base + openvswitch-base when building openvswitch images) and now we start the build of the openvswitch images with "^openvswitch". We do not want to maintain a list of all openvswitch images, we want to build everything inside the openvswitch directory.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-01-28 11:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In stage 2 we pull required base images and build the openvswitch images...'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-01-28 11:15:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

--skip-parents did not work for all images on Rocky. Maybe this was fixed in the meanwhile? Then this change is not necessary.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2020-01-28 11:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> --skip-parents did not work for all images on Rocky. Maybe this was
 > fixed in the meanwhile? Then this change is not necessary.

No idea does work as expected. It is so rarely used part of Kolla. I know about it as had to play with it during adding UNBUILDABLE_IMAGES support.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-01-28 11:22:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I tried it with "kolla-build --skip-parents ^openvswitch" on Rocky and this skipped the base image but it rebuilt the openvswitch-base image.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2020-01-28 12:16:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(venv3) 12:48 (7s) hrw@puchatek:kolla$ ./tools/build.py openvswitch-base
INFO:kolla.common.utils:=========================
INFO:kolla.common.utils:Successfully built images
INFO:kolla.common.utils:=========================
INFO:kolla.common.utils:base
INFO:kolla.common.utils:openvswitch-base

(venv3) 13:14 (9s) hrw@puchatek:kolla$ ./tools/build.py ^openvswitch --skip-parents
INFO:kolla.common.utils:=========================
INFO:kolla.common.utils:Successfully built images
INFO:kolla.common.utils:=========================
INFO:kolla.common.utils:openvswitch-db-server
INFO:kolla.common.utils:openvswitch-vswitchd
INFO:kolla.common.utils:===================================
INFO:kolla.common.utils:Images skipped due to build options
INFO:kolla.common.utils:===================================
INFO:kolla.common.utils:openvswitch-base
INFO:kolla.common.utils:=========================================
INFO:kolla.common.utils:Images not buildable due to build options
INFO:kolla.common.utils:=========================================
INFO:kolla.common.utils:openvswitch-netcontrold


Looks like it works now. Did not even tried to build openvswitch-base in second run.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-01-28 16:22:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We have divided the build process into several stages. Base Images, Infrastructure Images, OpenStack Core Images and OpenStack Additional Images.

Thanks for the test. Then the review can be closed if it works on the master.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-01-28 16:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-16 11:31:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Working on an alternative. Would like to know if it fixes your issue.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-16 13:00:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Working on an alternative. Would like to know if it fixes your
 > issue.

https://review.opendev.org/713221'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-28 10:49:24.000000000', 'message': 'Do not rebuild existing images, but allow the children to be built

When using --skip-existing, only parent images are currently checked.

E.g. if openvswitch is to be built it is checked if base exists. If base
exists it will be skipped. If openvswitch-base already exists it will be
built anyway.

With this change, existing images are really not rebuilt. Builds by children
of the skipped images are still triggered.

Change-Id: I4e5face2d8591db7f54738fe54702e63bc28eea8
'}]
commit_message:
Do not rebuild existing images, but allow the children to be built

When using --skip-existing, only parent images are currently checked.

E.g. if openvswitch is to be built it is checked if base exists. If base
exists it will be skipped. If openvswitch-base already exists it will be
built anyway.

With this change, existing images are really not rebuilt. Builds by children
of the skipped images are still triggered.

Change-Id: I4e5face2d8591db7f54738fe54702e63bc28eea8

commit_message:
Basic functional test for Bionic Ussuri and Docs changes

This patch adds a bare minimum bundle.yaml for deploying
watcher-dashboard charm and running a noop basic test. In addition, it
changes the initial information to point to upstream after the official
release of charm-watcher-dashboard. It also adds the appropriate repo
configuration and conforms to the new removed packages mechanism.

Change-Id: I0a44436c4d292aaaa7ce37a3792c205056b37f17
Signed-off-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>

commit_message:
Upgrade pause image to version 3.1

k8s.gcr.io/pause image repository support mutilarch on version 3.1.
Pulling other non-amd64 arch image, no need to go to other arch specific
repository ,like pause-arm64. It is easy to support mutilarch, like
amd64, arm64, ppc64le, if use version 3.1.
See 3.1 manifest:
https://console.cloud.google.com/gcr/images/google-containers/GLOBAL/pause@sha256:f78411e19d84a252e53bff71a4407a5686c46983a2c2eeed83929b888179acea/details?tab=info

commit_message:
Remove usage of platform.linux_distribution

This function was deprecated and is removed in Python 3.8.

We can't remove all of the code as the unit tests are relying
on being able to mock this function.

Remove explicit python-devel requirement from oslo packages

We had two oslo packages with an explicit requirement on python-devel,
removing them.

subject: ci: move opensuse jobs to experimental
messages:
[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-02-24 12:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-02-24 13:05:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Not sure we really need it at this point, since suse is kinda working now and don't bring lot of problems at the moment."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-02-25 12:42:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thinking about it a bit more, we even can't do it this way. Suse was supported for bunch of releases, so we should decide that we really don't want to do anything for suse on the meeting, and after that call for interested parts trough ML. But not just silently drop support of one of the distros, which currently passes all CI."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-02-26 12:59:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

we've asked them to help maintain it like 3 times and everytime we get someone to playaround with it for a few days and then disappear. :("}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-02-28 07:25:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Anyway I'd postpone raising this question to the point when we will have some issues with suse and they won't be willing to help with it.
Since it just works as for now, we can probably leave it as is as for now, or just drop distro version (since it's non voting) and drop periodics (but we probably need to fix ones responsible for docs update)"}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-03-16 12:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-24 12:43:36.000000000', 'message': "ci: move opensuse jobs to experimental

We don't have a maintainer and the jobs are taking up resources
with no one really looking over them.  This also drops the periodic jobs
which no one is paying attention to.

Change-Id: I2b7fb155cde2e749cbf442b71d386a4c07fbbb52
"}]
commit_message:
ci: move opensuse jobs to experimental

We don't have a maintainer and the jobs are taking up resources
with no one really looking over them.  This also drops the periodic jobs
which no one is paying attention to.

Change-Id: I2b7fb155cde2e749cbf442b71d386a4c07fbbb52

commit_message:
atomic-podman: Set log imit to 50m

By default podman containers can write unlimited bytes
of log and evenrually fill up the disk nodes.

Set the max size per containers to 50MB.

story: 2007402
task: 39003
Change-Id: I405e331eb1f9f987d3fbc301a09ab25bcb96926d
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

Until now we had only the output of the Fedora
CoreOS Configuration Transpiler. Add a yaml
that can transpile it to an ignition file.

The current ignition file was generate with
version v0.4.0:
podman run --rm -v ./fcct-config.yaml:/config.fcc:z \
quay.io/coreos/fcct:v0.4.0 \
--pretty --strict --input /config.fcc > ./user_data.json

commit_message:
Add fcct config for coreos user_data

Until now we had only the output of the Fedora
CoreOS Configuration Transpiler. Add a yaml
that can transpile it to an ignition file.

The current ignition file was generate with
version v0.4.0:
podman run --rm -v ./fcct-config.yaml:/config.fcc:z \
quay.io/coreos/fcct:v0.4.0 \
--pretty --strict --input /config.fcc > ./user_data.json

story: 2005201
task: 39027

Change-Id: I5cb78aa625c926e101424c04573002d05ac82a59
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

(cherry picked from commit 78435e4ff82470a37044ce45908692d78d140b63)

Fix bulk port tag test_type_args_passed_to_extension()

It was checking the call arguments incorrectly, which was
caught by unittest.mock but not by mock library.

Trivialfix

subject: oslo.policy: downgrade to 2.4.1
messages: [{'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2020-03-16 09:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2020-03-16 10:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2020-03-16 12:08:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-16 09:26:14.000000000', 'message': 'oslo.policy: downgrade to 2.4.1

The version 3.0.0 causes all sphinx-build jobs to fail with errors
similar to this:

    oslo_config.cfg.ArgsAlreadyParsedError: arguments already parsed: cannot register CLI option

Thats why the 3.0.0 release is currently blacklisted in global u-c

Change-Id: I7de19da898f6962c40729bc908d2bc70f0267cfc
'}]
commit_message:
oslo.policy: downgrade to 2.4.1

The version 3.0.0 causes all sphinx-build jobs to fail with errors
similar to this:

    oslo_config.cfg.ArgsAlreadyParsedError: arguments already parsed: cannot register CLI option

Thats why the 3.0.0 release is currently blacklisted in global u-c

Change-Id: I7de19da898f6962c40729bc908d2bc70f0267cfc

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-10 20:41:47.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid multiple calls to create_ip_cert_links

Prior to this change, the call to create_ip_cert_links was inside the
for loop of tls objects. This caused LP Bug#1866741 where a sym link
with the same certificate name would get overwritten with a new cert.
This meant the last certificate of [internal, admin, public] would be
written to all three.

This change calls create_ip_cert_links and state sets only once. It also
adds a warning log entry if we accidentally overwrite sym linked files in
the future.

Change-Id: I4b36d7fd5e74ab3a894eb4a2451b5876fd777552
Partial-Bug: #1866741

commit_message:
Avoid multiple calls to create_ip_cert_links

Prior to this change, the call to create_ip_cert_links was inside the
for loop of tls objects. This caused LP Bug#1866741 where a sym link
with the same certificate name would get overwritten with a new cert.
This meant the last certificate of [internal, admin, public] would be
written to all three.

This change calls create_ip_cert_links and state sets only once. It also
adds a warning log entry if we accidentally overwrite sym linked files in
the future.

Change-Id: I4b36d7fd5e74ab3a894eb4a2451b5876fd777552
Partial-Bug: #1866741

commit_message:
Add config and change Docs and URLs

This patch changes the initial information to point to upstream after
the official release of charm-watcher-dashboard. It also adds the
appropriate repo configuration and conforms to the new removed
packages mechanism.

Change-Id: Ib41538878899f87546607ff9d4349bd42327d95c
Signed-off-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>

commit_message:
do not use unversioned Python binary

We said 'bye' to Python 2 already. So let us use Python 3 for all
scripts.

Unversioned Python binary should be avoided as it may be Python2 or
Python3 (depends on distribution).

Implements: blueprint drop-py2-support

Change-Id: Ifd7912a3debf3ee4ddd8f3e1a4c5870848d4d688

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

commit_message:
Limit time for pod creation

Busy-waiting for POD creation for a number of seconds
(240 by default). If expired throws a TimeoutException.

Reuse static method wait_for_pod_status.

Change-Id: I1e212871e564ba3e10fa39c1bd7a2c5946954bb9

commit_message:
neutron-base: drop python3-networking-ovn

This code is now part of neutron, as part of ML2/OVS convergence
with OVN work [1].

[1]: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/neutron-ovn-merge

Change-Id: I704d231ead35cf94a712a5bccdd7a427c46077c7

commit_message:
[Q->T] Introduce Queens to Train Upgrade

In order to do Q->T upgrade we need Stein container images available.
We check for namespace_stein and if it's defined we provide them.

Change-Id: I8820293bd1c7f83c00e7abba88181895ef987765

subject: renderspec: Fix -doc dependency on the base package
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 7102, 'name': 'Thomas Bechtold', 'email': 'thomas.bechtold@canonical.com', 'username': 'toabctl'}, {'_account_id': 13294, 'name': 'Javier Peña', 'email': 'jpena@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpena'}, {'_account_id': 19648, 'name': 'SUSE Cloud CI', 'email': 'dmueller+suse-cloud-ci@suse.de', 'username': 'suse-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2020-02-13 16:00:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2020-02-13 17:35:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

the point of the dependency is that the doc package gets updated if somebody only updates "renderspec". 

you could change it to 

Conflicts: %{name} != %{version}

would that work for you?'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2020-02-13 17:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> the point of the dependency is that the doc package gets updated if
 > somebody only updates "renderspec".
 > 
 > you could change it to
 > 
 > Conflicts: %{name} != %{version}
 > 
 > would that work for you?

Hm, in this case, let's make it

Requires: {{ py2name(py_versions='py3') }} ...

It was failing to install because now it requires python-renderspec, when it should be python3-renderspec.

Is that ok?'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2020-02-17 10:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2020-02-18 10:34:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2020-03-16 11:29:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit 149c30b68f8ca81caab8b374063a1d4333bec43c'}]

'}]
commit_message:
renderspec: Fix -doc dependency on the base package

It needs to depend on python3-renderspec, not python-renderspec.

Change-Id: I18f9dd894417ade8ac50755b7cb2958352cade0f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-26 13:06:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add collectd-pcie-errors package for PCIe Errors (C7 only)

The pcie_errors plugin collects PCI Express errors from Device Status in
Capability structure and from Advanced Error Reporting Extended Capability
where available.

C7 only - C8 packaging still pending.

commit_message:
Add collectd-pcie-errors package for PCIe Errors

The pcie_errors plugin collects PCI Express errors from Device Status in
Capability structure and from Advanced Error Reporting Extended Capability
where available.

Change-Id: I9c600570dd2166e865878e7c2584a8377a795a43

Use "unittest.mock" library and drop "mock" installation

As commented in [1], "unittest.mock" has been supported in the Python
internal unit testing framework since version 3.3.

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-March/013281.html

commit_message:
Update packages removed for FFWD2 and clean http dir.

To upgrade the Operating System in OSP13 from RHEL7 to
RHEL8 it is needed to remove some more packages than
what we required in the upgrade from Rocky to Stein.

Also, removing the httpd service and wiping out its
directory to allow the recreation during deploy steps.

Change-Id: I2dd4ac020652193849e622b5d67bc365113d9d3f

commit_message:
Adding support for cross_az_attach config option.

Allow attach between instance and volume in different
availability zones. If False, volumes attached to an
instance must be in the same availability zone
in Cinder as the instance availability zone in Nova.

Change-Id: I21df8e0dfa585133c5ef6a55cdbbc2071c267424
Closes-Bug: #1856776

commit_message:
Remove Congress service from roles_data.

Congress templates where removed completely in Stein [0].
Therefore, there is no need to keep the service inside
any customized roles_data.

This patch parses the customized roles_data passed during
the upgrade prepare step and removes the Congress service.

[0] - Idca6b12f1c0ca3bc15bedf6469d4063a4dac31fa

Change-Id: I4b658b7739d7620db54ec01bcaeea37b2fc6a34d

commit_message:
Reproduce bug 1862633

If port update fails during unshelve of an offloaded server then
placement allocation on the target host is leaked.

Change-Id: I7be32e4fc2e69f805535e0a437931516f491e5cb
Related-Bug: #1862633
(cherry picked from commit c33ebdafbd633578a0a4b6f1b118c756510acea6)
(cherry picked from commit bd1bfc13d7e2c418afc409871ab56da454a1334d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-13 17:16:38.000000000', 'message': "Enhance service restart in functional env

Bugfix Icaf1bae8cb040b939f916a19ce026031ddb84af7 showed that restarting
a compute service in the functional env is unrealistic causing faults
to slip through. During that bug fix only the minimal change was done
in the functional env regarding compute service restart to reproduce
the reported fault. However the restart of the compute service could
be made even more realistic.

This patch simulates a compute service restart in the functional env
by stopping the original compute service and starting a totally new
compute service for the same host and node. This way we can make sure
that we get a brand new ComputeManager in the new service and no
state can leak between the old and the new service.

This change revealed another shortcoming of the functional env.
In the real world the nova-compute service could be restarted without
loosing any running servers on the compute host. But with the naive
implementation of this change the compute service is re-created. This
means that a new ComputeManager is instantiated that loads a new
FakeDriver instance as well. That new FakeDriver instance then reports
an empty hypervisor. This behavior is not totally unrealistic as it
simulates such a compute host restart that cleans the hypervisor state
as well (e.g. compute host redeployment). However this type of restart
shows another bug in the code path that destroys and deallocates
evacuated instance from the source host. Therefore this patch
implements the compute service restart in a way that simulates only a
service restart and not a full compute restart. A subsequent patch will
add a test that uses the clean hypervisor case to reproduces the
revealed bug.

Related-Bug: #1724172

On stable/stein:

Closes-Bug: #1859766

Conflicts:
    doc/notification_samples/libvirt-connect-error.json
    nova/test.py
    nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_reshape.py
    nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(elod.illes): files conflicts details:
* libvirt-connect-error.json:
  File added only in Stein with libvirt.error notification
  transformation patch I7d2287ce06d77c0afdef0ea8bdfb70f6c52d3c50
* test.py:
  Patches Iecf4dcf8e648c9191bf8846428683ec81812c026 (Remove patching
  the mock lib) and Ibb8c12fb2799bb5ceb9e3d72a2b86dbb4f14451e (Use a
  static resource tracker in compute manager) were not backported to
  Rocky
* test_reshape.py:
  File added only in Stein in the frame of 'Handling Reshaped Provider
  Trees' feature, with patch Ide797ebf7790d69042ae275ebec6ced3fa4787b6
* test_servers.py:
  Patch I7cbd5d9fb875ebf72995362e0b6693492ce32051 (Reject forced move
  with nested source allocation) is not present in Rocky as it is part
  of 'Nested Resource Providers - Allocation Candidates' implemented in
  Stein

Change-Id: I9d6cd6259659a35383c0c9c21db72a9434ba86b1
(cherry picked from commit 2794748d9c58623045023f34c7793c58ce41447c)
(cherry picked from commit b874c409c11b5d83508d2f0276a9a648f72192a4)
"}]
commit_message:
Enhance service restart in functional env

Bugfix Icaf1bae8cb040b939f916a19ce026031ddb84af7 showed that restarting
a compute service in the functional env is unrealistic causing faults
to slip through. During that bug fix only the minimal change was done
in the functional env regarding compute service restart to reproduce
the reported fault. However the restart of the compute service could
be made even more realistic.

This patch simulates a compute service restart in the functional env
by stopping the original compute service and starting a totally new
compute service for the same host and node. This way we can make sure
that we get a brand new ComputeManager in the new service and no
state can leak between the old and the new service.

This change revealed another shortcoming of the functional env.
In the real world the nova-compute service could be restarted without
loosing any running servers on the compute host. But with the naive
implementation of this change the compute service is re-created. This
means that a new ComputeManager is instantiated that loads a new
FakeDriver instance as well. That new FakeDriver instance then reports
an empty hypervisor. This behavior is not totally unrealistic as it
simulates such a compute host restart that cleans the hypervisor state
as well (e.g. compute host redeployment). However this type of restart
shows another bug in the code path that destroys and deallocates
evacuated instance from the source host. Therefore this patch
implements the compute service restart in a way that simulates only a
service restart and not a full compute restart. A subsequent patch will
add a test that uses the clean hypervisor case to reproduces the
revealed bug.

Related-Bug: #1724172

On stable/stein:

Closes-Bug: #1859766

Conflicts:
    doc/notification_samples/libvirt-connect-error.json
    nova/test.py
    nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_reshape.py
    nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(elod.illes): files conflicts details:
* libvirt-connect-error.json:
  File added only in Stein with libvirt.error notification
  transformation patch I7d2287ce06d77c0afdef0ea8bdfb70f6c52d3c50
* test.py:
  Patches Iecf4dcf8e648c9191bf8846428683ec81812c026 (Remove patching
  the mock lib) and Ibb8c12fb2799bb5ceb9e3d72a2b86dbb4f14451e (Use a
  static resource tracker in compute manager) were not backported to
  Rocky
* test_reshape.py:
  File added only in Stein in the frame of 'Handling Reshaped Provider
  Trees' feature, with patch Ide797ebf7790d69042ae275ebec6ced3fa4787b6
* test_servers.py:
  Patch I7cbd5d9fb875ebf72995362e0b6693492ce32051 (Reject forced move
  with nested source allocation) is not present in Rocky as it is part
  of 'Nested Resource Providers - Allocation Candidates' implemented in
  Stein

Change-Id: I9d6cd6259659a35383c0c9c21db72a9434ba86b1
(cherry picked from commit 2794748d9c58623045023f34c7793c58ce41447c)
(cherry picked from commit b874c409c11b5d83508d2f0276a9a648f72192a4)

commit_message:
Remove global state from the FakeDriver

The virt driver FakeDriver used in both the functional and in the unit
test used a global state to configure the host and node names the driver
reports. This was hard to use when more then one compute service is started.
Also global state is dangerous.

It turned out that only a set of unit tests are using multiple nodes per
compute the rest of the tests can simply use host=<hostname>,
nodes=[<hostname>] setup.

So this removes the global state.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/functional/compute/test_live_migration.py

commit_message:
Add cinderlib RPM to cinder-volume

Finding the root cause of attach/detach operation on volumes can be very
complicated.

This patch adds the cinderlib RPM to the cinder-volume container, which
can, in many scenarios, really help debug these issues on live nodes
(controller and compute) without affecting our running services.

Change-Id: I5f55c892b1ae9eba9b6af8a45ef7dfad515c7b05
(cherry picked from commit a1b74b76977f8300938c6a6a9adf67af6cd50086)

When doing a source install, ironic doesn't have python3-systemd as a
dependency and the current ironic-conductor container doesn't install
the required dependencies which causes the ansible deploy interface to

(cherry picked from commit 4a67e58f7971641c55247f02985e13ef391ca7ab)

commit_message:
Adds python3-systemd for ansible deploy interface

When doing a source install, ironic doesn't have python3-systemd as a
dependency and the current ironic-conductor container doesn't install
the required dependencies which causes the ansible deploy interface to
fail with the error, "Systemd bindings do not exist".  This adds the
needed dependencies when doing a source build.  This installs the needed
files for both rpm and deb builds on python 2.x and 3.x.

Change-Id: I5d1bcb0f7d7902b4e122c12697483433bcf52ca2
Closes-Bug: #1861427
(cherry picked from commit 4a67e58f7971641c55247f02985e13ef391ca7ab)

commit_message:
kibana, nova-libvirt: handle it properly for non-x86

Upstream kibana package contains NodeJS x86-64 binaries so can not be
used directly on non-x86 architectures. I took upstream packages,
removed NodeJS binary from it and added 'nodejs' dependency.

Package is present in my Linaro OBS repository where I keep other
packages needed for aarch64 kolla run. Via APT pinning I mark them as
not wanted so they are not used on any architecture with two exceptions:

1. libvirt - we need fixed version to be able to use ThunderX servers
2. kibana - to be able to run it at all

For x86-64 upstream kibana package is used.

Closes-bug: #1867365

Change-Id: I456402849022100bde1fffdfbf6292b35690f0f2

[{'created': '2020-03-02 15:04:56.000000000', 'message': 'Improve upload-swift-artifacts handling of json data

The "openstack container show" output changed, and the value of the
properties field is json (meaning that specifying "-f value" doesn't
eliminate the json formatting). This patch replaces sed to parse the
output with a jq expression that knows how to handle json.

Misc notes:
- Using "jq -r" tells jq not to quote the value of the Temp-URL-Key
- In the jq expression, "Temp-URL-Key" must be quoted or else the jq
  parser stumbles on the '-' dashes

Change-Id: Ife347f754ca9129580c092bb271bacdc032ae14b
(cherry picked from commit c97180ce00e91673990311276c8dcb59af379a1f)

commit_message:
Improve upload-swift-artifacts handling of json data

The "openstack container show" output changed, and the value of the
properties field is json (meaning that specifying "-f value" doesn't
eliminate the json formatting). This patch replaces sed to parse the
output with a jq expression that knows how to handle json.

Misc notes:
- Using "jq -r" tells jq not to quote the value of the Temp-URL-Key
- In the jq expression, "Temp-URL-Key" must be quoted or else the jq
  parser stumbles on the '-' dashes

Change-Id: Ife347f754ca9129580c092bb271bacdc032ae14b
(cherry picked from commit c97180ce00e91673990311276c8dcb59af379a1f)

This is proof that the kubelet options do not work.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-03-11 17:17:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
k8s-fedora: Set max-size to 10m for containers

Set the max-size for container/pod logs to 10m
and max of 5 rotated files. The values relay
the default of kubernetes when it is using
a remote container runtime [0] (container-log-max-files
and container-log-max-size) This defaults cover the
case of containerd.

[0] https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/command-line-tools-reference/kubelet/

story: 2007402
task: 39031

Change-Id: Ie3106b40b4d1c6866761c507122047e88e513651
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <strigazi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add fcct config for coreos user_data

Until now we had only the output of the Fedora
CoreOS Configuration Transpiler. Add a yaml
that can transpile it to an ignition file.

The current ignition file was generate with
version v0.4.0:
podman run --rm -v ./fcct-config.yaml:/config.fcc:z \
quay.io/coreos/fcct:v0.4.0 \
--pretty --strict --input /config.fcc > ./user_data.json

story: 2005201
task: 39027

Change-Id: I5cb78aa625c926e101424c04573002d05ac82a59
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-16 18:21:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix: Show transfer with name

Currently when we show a volume transfer by name, it errors out as
NotFound.
The reason is [1] introduced pagination support for volume transfers
which includes a filter[2] in transfers which didn't exist before[3][4].
The filter functionality is right since it catched the issue that
argument passed from the client 'name'[5] exists as 'display_name'
in the transfers table[6].
One way to fix this is to alter 'name' filter to 'display_name' in
the filter function which doesn't seem right.
This patch fixes the issue from source by altering the same in
volume transfer list request.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/311c5153bc7a9c13a670e102dee54a91b1adbb43
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L5417

"}, {'created': '2020-01-17 17:52:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix: Show transfer with name

Currently when we show a volume transfer by name, it errors out as
NotFound.
The reason is [1] introduced pagination support for volume transfers
which includes a filter[2] in transfers which didn't exist before[3][4].
The filter functionality is right since it catched the issue that
argument passed from the client 'name'[5] exists as 'display_name'
in the transfers table[6].
One way to fix this is to alter 'name' filter to 'display_name' in
the filter function which doesn't seem right.
This patch fixes the issue from source by altering the same in
volume transfer list request.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/311c5153bc7a9c13a670e102dee54a91b1adbb43
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L5417

[6] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/stable/queens/cinder/db/sqlalchemy/models.py#L829

commit_message:
Add filters support for volume transfer

Currently ``id`` and ``volume_id`` filters are working
correctly for transfer-list command.
support for filtering by ``name`` is handled in patch
provided in Depends-On.
Since filtering by all parameters is supported by API,
we can happily add the filters option on the client for
volume transfers.

Also adds functional test for transfers.

Related-Bug: #1860100

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703658/

Change-Id: I2fd3a6a7b9add65a9a21388df44efb6747065a74

commit_message:

This change removes all of mistral from the provide workflows
by calling the new provide playbook.

Task: 38443
Task: 38446

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 14:03:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add a lookup plugin to get mistral workflow results

This patch adds a lookup plugin for validation playbooks to start a workflow
via Mistral and wait for the result in a synchronous fashion. It does it in
three steps:

1. Establish a websocket connection to wait for Zaqar messages
2. Create a workflow execution for a given workflow via Mistral
3. When the workflow sends a SUCCESS or FAILED result, fetch the full execution
   from Mistral

When the result is retrieved it is handed back from the plugin as the only
element of a list.

Change-Id: Ic9aa047124cf4fcc51959315798bdabc94a42740
'}, {'created': '2018-07-09 07:59:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add a lookup plugin to get mistral workflow results

commit_message:
Add a lookup plugin to get mistral workflow results

This patch adds a lookup plugin for validation playbooks to start a
workflow via Mistral and wait for the result in a synchronous fashion.
It does it in three steps:

1. Establish a websocket connection to wait for Zaqar messages
2. Create a workflow execution for a given workflow via Mistral
3. When the workflow sends a SUCCESS or FAILED result, fetch the full
   execution from Mistral
4. If no message arrives via the websocket connection within 20 seconds
   start polling the workflow API for the execution result

When the result is retrieved it is handed back from the plugin as the
only element of a list.

Change-Id: Ic9aa047124cf4fcc51959315798bdabc94a42740

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-23 17:08:43.000000000', 'message': "Port the network env validation to use parameters

This patch changes the network environment validation use the result of a
Mistral tripleo.parameters.get call to validate the network settings instead of
looking at the environment files directly.

Looking at the environment files had two major drawbacks:

- If the environment wasn't active the validation would still validate and
  output errors, even if those weren't relevant.
- If changes are made to the plan environment that override the values in
  the environment files, these changes were not recognized by the validation.

This change removes these two drawbacks by only looking at the parameters
resulting from the Mistral/Heat call.

Change-Id: I6b150b08b511e318370594a4154ed2d8a2094bc7

commit_message:
Port the network env validation to use parameters

This patch changes the network environment validation use the result of a
Mistral tripleo.parameters.get call to validate the network settings
instead of looking at the environment files directly.

Looking at the environment files had two major drawbacks:

- If the environment wasn't active the validation would still validate
  and output errors, even if those weren't relevant.
- If changes are made to the plan environment that override the values
  in the environment files, these changes were not recognized by the
  validation.

This change removes these two drawbacks by only looking at the parameters
resulting from the Mistral/Heat call.

Change-Id: I6b150b08b511e318370594a4154ed2d8a2094bc7

commit_message:
Centralize basepython as py3 in tox

OpenStack ussuri release will be python 3 only
so let's define the basepython in common env now.

Change-Id: I431523d0cd23c227e535c471bb0c74a3586fa696

(5 comments)

Some misconceptions about Octavia. First post of comments to correct those. More comments to come.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2020-02-27 17:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9237, 'date': '2020-02-27 18:01:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(8 comments)

In general, this looks very good! :)

There is some overlap with the wg-multitenancy kubernetes workgroup so starting up a conversation there would be great.'}, {'account_id': 9237, 'date': '2020-02-27 18:06:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9237, 'date': '2020-02-27 18:08:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

One thing not defined here is an api for tenant creation/management. wg-multitenancy has been working on one that could potentially map to this. Tenant CR -> cluster api cluster -> metallb provisioned cluster.'}, {'account_id': 9237, 'date': '2020-02-27 18:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-02-27 20:23:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(32 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9237, 'date': '2020-02-27 21:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-02-28 05:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(34 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-28 08:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I love the fact that we have so many people working on this, it's amazing!

Because this is a very big project, we'll have tons of people +1 and -1-ing it (because there will be disagreements...), would it make sense to have those conversations on another media than the review (like the mailing lists), and refer to the outcomes here? I have the impression it could be more productive this way, but if you prefer having it here, it's fine. I just don't want Zane to burn due to reviews.

Keep in mind, an idea is ALWAYS approved, whether there is contention or not. For me, the problematic point(s) should be documented for the "idea record" to reflect the current world.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-02-28 12:57:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think Gerrit is actually a great place to discuss, because you can do line-by-line comments. There's no way you could review an 8k word document by email like that.
Once we get through this first round of reviews and correcting errors, we can publish it and move further discussion to the mailing list."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-28 13:18:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I think Gerrit is actually a great place to discuss, because you
 > can do line-by-line comments. There's no way you could review an 8k
 > word document by email like that.
 > Once we get through this first round of reviews and correcting
 > errors, we can publish it and move further discussion to the
 > mailing list.

Sounds good!"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-28 16:00:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ideas should refer on ML threads, shouldn't be judged on their merits (only based on the conversations on the MLs).

For large topics such as this one, the ML need some kind of content first. This is the reason we should merge this ASAP, _without_ a reference of the mailing lists, to allow further conversations and refinements.

Thanks Zane for this write-up!"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-03-09 19:30:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

No real objection to the overall higher level concept though, just a feeling that we may be repeating mistakes by also setting such a grand idea up.'}, {'account_id': 6994, 'date': '2020-03-10 02:33:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Add Project Teapot idea

Project Teapot is a design proposal for a bare-metal cloud to run
Kubernetes on, and which itself also runs on Kubernetes.

Change-Id: I5e0c63583318e64af9ec91f908eb8eac745ac907

commit_message:
Remove the mistral from the clean_.*_nodes workflow

This change removes all of mistral from the clean_nodes and clean_manageable_nodes
workflows by calling the new cleaning playbook.

Story: 2007212
Task: 38451
Task: 38452

Depends-On: I0e3f50ff2bdc16b6a148977b39a12023d5b30b3e
Change-Id: I0b1981a82b1ae5d2b52a74250b623218a0cb6c0d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
We need to use the MAC instead of PCI Address for Mellanox cards

Since Mellanox cards are already bound, they are not added
to the dpdk mapping file. The set devargs command is never run.

This patch ensures that get_dpdk_devargs returns the devargs,
even on newer Mellanox interfaces.

Change-Id: I6f4c3716c7ee74d7bd2c48e598e5c6de4332d726
Closes-Bug: 1862298
(cherry picked from commit 11d9a23600e43de0071f05e716ec6f7e1ee80670)
(cherry picked from commit 74d32121f6b807ef646f6dc58ad8693233503f1e)
(cherry picked from commit de626b2609f531727c336513faf2fa27ea377e5b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-02 05:26:05.000000000', 'message': "Refactor image upload command

In preparation for supporting deploys on a glance-less undercloud,
this change refactors the upload command to move all glance
interacting logic into a glance adapter class. This will allow the
adapter abstraction to be used for an 'upload' adapter which only
copies files on the local disk.

This change also does the following:
- moves repeated update-or-upload logic to an adapter method, reducing
  the complexity of take_action
- cleans up the mock usage to consistently use the
  patch decorator - the current approach may be causing unit test
  failures in some environments
- removes the GlanceV1 implementation, since the V1 API was removed in
  Newton(!) this support is just a maintenance burden

Change-Id: Ie28dabaf07ed36adb3e8f07ca8c141f93a9d79cc
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy
(cherry picked from commit c88da0a63233abd839e87b52adfd546df0a74c06)
"}, {'created': '2020-03-04 20:56:16.000000000', 'message': "Refactor image upload command

commit_message:
Refactor image upload command

In preparation for supporting deploys on a glance-less undercloud,
this change refactors the upload command to move all glance
interacting logic into a glance adapter class. This will allow the
adapter abstraction to be used for an 'upload' adapter which only
copies files on the local disk.

This change also does the following:
- moves repeated update-or-upload logic to an adapter method, reducing
  the complexity of take_action
- cleans up the mock usage to consistently use the
  patch decorator - the current approach may be causing unit test
  failures in some environments
- removes the GlanceV1 implementation, since the V1 API was removed in
  Newton(!) this support is just a maintenance burden

Change-Id: Ie28dabaf07ed36adb3e8f07ca8c141f93a9d79cc
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/711271
(cherry picked from commit c88da0a63233abd839e87b52adfd546df0a74c06)

commit_message:
Remove mistral from the introspection workflows

This change removes all of mistral from the introspection workflows
by calling the new introspection playbook.

Story: 2007212
Task: 38444
Task: 38445

Change-Id: I48bedfe9a705f5ff8e0eed1f852b77938d53c763
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove pypy jobs

pypy jobs are non-voting and do not work. let's drop it
till someone fix the tool.

We so not run pypy jobs in other projects.

Change-Id: I6677bdda81253c94076a542a48b937224575cff4

commit_message:
Predictable IPs, no resource_registry override

Support for predictable IP addressing added to the
default port templates in Rocky. The resource
registry overrides are removed the depends-on.

Change-Id: Ib9410e6f6415d3f91a477414930a236f1dc284c8
Related-Bug: #1866215
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/711537

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-20 21:24:26.000000000', 'message': "Disable old-style-class check by default

In Python3, all objects inherit 'object' and there is no need to
inherit 'object' in class declarations as we do in python2.
pylint 2.0 added a new check useless-object-inheritance and
if this check is enabled in pylint, we need to disable the
old-style-class check in hacking. We are now in py3 era,
so it sounds good to disable it by default.

Change-Id: Iaebcf267de9ef826b8cc387d1fa1f2eccff2c050
"}]
commit_message:
Disable old-style-class check by default

In Python3, all objects inherit 'object' and there is no need to
inherit 'object' in class declarations as we do in python2.
pylint 2.0 added a new check useless-object-inheritance and
if this check is enabled in pylint, we need to disable the
old-style-class check in hacking. We are now in py3 era,
so it sounds good to disable it by default.

Change-Id: Iaebcf267de9ef826b8cc387d1fa1f2eccff2c050

commit_message:
Add cinder_csi_enabled label

Add support for out of tree Cinder CSI. This is installed when the
cinder_csi_enabled=true label is added. This will allow us to eventually
deprecate in-tree Cinder.

story: 2007048
task: 37868

Change-Id: I8305b9f8c9c37518ec39198693adb6f18542bf2e
Signed-off-by: Bharat Kunwar <brtknr@bath.edu>

commit_message:
Refactor memcached_servers

This patch aims to add a prefix for memcached_server
on each role to give the ability for deployers to
override the location of memcached cluster. I.e users
wants to create a single memcached cluster with k8s
for each service.

We also add pymemcache based on [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/711429

Change-Id: I1f808534cb115224c17eb82791b2178172547216

Support to test non-dev guest image in CI

Make the job non-voting because it may fail when the guest agent code
changes.

Add response schema validation for volume quota classes

This is to add response schema validation for volume
quota classes, also to remove the fields check in testcases.

(15 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-17 02:12:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

we need to be careful about strict validation vs optional fields. If any field is added in API then it should be via microvrersion bump. If it is not then we need to decide if doing strict JSON Schema validation in Tempest is required at all or not.  discussion in http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-September/009365.html'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-09-17 08:38:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> we need to be careful about strict validation vs optional fields.
 > If any field is added in API then it should be via microvrersion
 > bump. If it is not then we need to decide if doing strict JSON
 > Schema validation in Tempest is required at all or not.  discussion
 > in http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-September/009365.html

Seems we can hardly reach an agreement about whether to use microverion for fields added in response, but, I think for tempest things are simpler, we can add schema check according to the api-ref, and if some issues are found (like groups field) in older version, we can simply remove that field from required fields. That won't happen very often"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-25 23:24:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> > we need to be careful about strict validation vs optional fields.
 > > If any field is added in API then it should be via microvrersion
 > > bump. If it is not then we need to decide if doing strict JSON
 > > Schema validation in Tempest is required at all or not. 
 > discussion
 > > in http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-September/009365.html
 > 
 > Seems we can hardly reach an agreement about whether to use
 > microverion for fields added in response, but, I think for tempest
 > things are simpler, we can add schema check according to the
 > api-ref, and if some issues are found (like groups field) in older
 > version, we can simply remove that field from required fields. That
 > won't happen very often

I replied on ML. We should not relax the schema otherwise it fail too achieve the main goal of strict validation. We need to add schema as per what code return and as per API interoperability guidlines from api-wg- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/api_interoperability.html"}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-09-26 08:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@gmann, and then how about these schema validation patches? going on or still waiting for agreements?'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-03-16 00:01:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> @gmann, and then how about these schema validation patches? going
 > on or still waiting for agreements?

we are good to go on these. sorry for delay.'}]

in api ref, I5f24a344755124fbc429f43a6970be00592a8ef2 will fix them.

commit_message:
Add response schema validation for volume types

This is to add response schema validation for volume
types.

Change-Id: I7ef9b3ea989d65dbd6dfa291ab4752664ed5f935
partially-implements: blueprint volume-response-schema-validation

commit_message:
Delete network quotas

NetworkQuotaService class enables deletion of network quotas which
were neglected by tempest cleanup before.

Change-Id: I83ac30960c0be39fc5147d445cb39cb3ff4c56b2

[{'created': '2019-06-03 02:58:59.000000000', 'message': 'remove duplicate entries under title guides in table of contents

right now, there are duplicate titles under contents --> guides
as shown in https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/, although
they will forward to different pages, it is still a little confusing
for users. This change will hide toctree in guides.rst and users could
click links in page to jump to detail page to read more.

Change-Id: I2f3abeca7f56a3aedeabb48630ed2c61635b93cd
'}]
commit_message:
remove duplicate entries under title guides in table of contents

right now, there are duplicate titles under contents --> guides
as shown in https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/, although
they will forward to different pages, it is still a little confusing
for users. This change will hide toctree in guides.rst and users could
click links in page to jump to detail page to read more.

Change-Id: I2f3abeca7f56a3aedeabb48630ed2c61635b93cd

commit_message:
Enable agent_token for virtual media boot

This provides an embedded agent_token through out of band
means which ensures greater security for such deployments.

Also some changes to the redfish virtual media boot unit
tests as the entirety of conductor utilties was mocked.

Downside with the pregenerated token, the logic had to be
slightly revised as the existence of a token with an older
client is a case that virtual media deployments will hit.

This was addressed, and tests updated as a result.

Story: 2007025
Task: 37819
Change-Id: Iaa2a52c2e53534cbf6998ad24f1f1184c0f222d8

[{'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2018-08-27 08:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-08-27 08:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

While I have never get why we have all these exchanges too.

Changing the exchange is tricky. Because you must keep backward compat with the other side talking on the old exchange.

For example, that change will break Nova rolling upgrades.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2018-08-27 08:49:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the feedback, fair enough. What if we add a config option? Would that work?'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-08-28 07:26:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

An option could work, but honestly a solution that fix the problem transparently for everybody will be better.

Also I'm not fan of a critical option will be not widely tested by the gate system, since all jobs will not have it configured by default.

We already having this kind of options in the past, and and we remove them because they always break, people making new feature never though about this kind of option that change the rabbitmq queues topology."}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2018-09-03 08:22:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Agree regarding a new useless option. We can do it stepwise without any options, please see PS2.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2018-09-03 08:23:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-09-03 10:00:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1732199

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2018-09-03 11:26:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This sounds reasonable, but I'd prefer to get input from one or more of our messaging experts before +2'ing."}, {'account_id': 7125, 'date': '2018-10-03 09:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-10-08 17:31:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

I've tried this patch running against rocky (both as rpc client and server) and it appears to work.

I'd be a bit more comfortable if sileht was ok with this patch as well."}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:16:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I like this, I have always wondered why it was this way but never took the time to change it.  This also has the side-effect of reducing the number of binding object as well.

I'm not even sure you need to be so careful about breaking backwards compatibility.  The exchange declared by the publisher and the consumer don't necessarily need to match.  All that really matter is that the queue is there for the consumer, and the publisher declares the exchange (and binding under the covers).

I can't think of a scenario, even during a rolling upgrade, where it would cause issues.  Here's how I imagine it working:

- Default state now before upgrade: exchange 'foo', binding on routing_key='foo' to queue 'foo'.  Publishers publish to 'foo' exchange, consumers consume from 'foo' queue.

- Rolling upgrade starts, on *new* nodes: exchange '', binding on routing_key='foo' to queue 'foo'.  Publishers on *new* nodes publish to default ('') exchange, all consumers *still* consume from 'foo' queue.  Publishers on old nodes can still publish to 'foo' exchange and the messages arrive to 'foo' queue.

- Rolling upgrade is finished, now all nodes: exchange '', binding on routing_key='foo' to queue 'foo'.  All publishers publish to default ('') exchange, all consumers *still* consume from 'foo' queue.  The 'foo' exchange will remain (unused) in RabbitMQ until the next cluster restart.  After RabbitMQ restart, nothing declares 'foo' exchange anymore."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-11-01 17:14:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Okay, this has been waiting long enough and I think we've got enough consensus that it should be fine, so let's do it."}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2020-03-16 00:40:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit b67a457e4fa71e9220c149087dce013c7f81144f'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-27 08:22:00.000000000', 'message': 'Use default exchange for direct messaging

Lots of exchanges create problems during failover under high
load. Please see bug report for details.

Change-Id: Id3603f4b7e1274b616d76e1c0c009d2ab7f6efb6
Closes-Bug: #1789177
'}, {'created': '2018-09-03 08:23:07.000000000', 'message': 'Use default exchange for direct messaging

Lots of exchanges create problems during failover under high
load. Please see bug report for details.

This is step 1 in the process: only using default exchange

commit_message:
Use default exchange for direct messaging

Lots of exchanges create problems during failover under high
load. Please see bug report for details.

This is step 1 in the process: only using default exchange
when publishing. Consumers will still consume on separate
exchanges (and on default exchange by default) so this
should be (and tested to be) a non-breaking and
upgrade-friendly change.

Step 2 is to update consumers to only listen on default exchange,
to happen in T release.

Change-Id: Id3603f4b7e1274b616d76e1c0c009d2ab7f6efb6
Closes-Bug: #1789177

[{'created': '2020-03-05 19:33:54.000000000', 'message': "Drop resource registry override in ip-from-pool

Support for predictable IP addressing added to the
default port templates in Rocky.

Let's stop using the from_pool fake port templates,
and instead use neutron ports for predictable IP's.

Using neutron ports add's value by:
- adding validations
- ensure no allocation conflicts
  I.e if you forget to include the environment file
  on a stack update/scale neutron won't pick a
  conflicting address etc.

The template (network/ports/port_from_pool.j2) to
create the fake port is required by the undercloud.
Operators can still use that if they want to not use
neutron for some reason.

Closes-Bug: #1866215
Change-Id: I4af2cb715dc5389821671aab9312a85d402f3215

commit_message:
Drop resource registry override in ip-from-pool

Support for predictable IP addressing added to the
default port templates in Rocky.

Let's stop using the from_pool fake port templates,
and instead use neutron ports for predictable IP's.

Using neutron ports add's value by:
- adding validations
- ensure no allocation conflicts
  I.e if you forget to include the environment file
  on a stack update/scale neutron won't pick a
  conflicting address etc.

The template (network/ports/port_from_pool.j2) to
create the fake port is required by the undercloud.
Operators can still use that if they want to not use
neutron for some reason.

Closes-Bug: #1866215
Change-Id: I4af2cb715dc5389821671aab9312a85d402f3215

commit_message:
Fix issue with neutron_api tests

There is a potential race condition when running
the unit tests with how eventlet is loaded. This
patch changes the neutron api implementation to use
GreenThreadPoolExecutor to make sure that
it does not fail depending on when eventlet applies
it's monkey patching.

Change-Id: I051d3ad8cd5af9b52d90dc28ebe99a3f0c8a17f2

commit_message:
Move grenade neutron forward job to py3 and in grenade repo

'legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-forward' grenade neutron forward jobs
is present in opensatck-zuul-jobs repo running on python 2. This needs
to run on py3 from Ussuri onwards and py2 for stable/branch.

py2 version has been kept in opensatck-zuul-jobs and for ussuri
onwwards this has been migrated to grenade repo with py3 version.

Change-Id: Ifebd2492b9af322661c18a17c3724940d065c2b5

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3795022705107595e34fd1c7b98636e11eb49aff

I'm actually a little concerned about backporting this since it is such a divergence from how things have been working. Plus we haven't really had much runtime on it is ussuri, so there's a risk that there will be some issue found with doing it this way that we aren't aware of yet.

All that said, we can always revert this, and if it's already made it out in a stable release we can always blacklist that release and quickly get a new release out that goes back to the previous behavior. So I think there's a slight risk, but it could be a nice improvement to get out there."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-03-12 09:54:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-03-12 12:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2020-02-25 00:13:15.000000000', 'message': "Read mounts from /proc/mounts instead of running mount

When creating multiple concurrent volumes, there's a lock
that prevents mount from returning quickly. Reading /proc/mounts
is way faster.

Change-Id: If31d120955eb216823a55005fdd3d24870aa6b9a
Closes-Bug: #1856889
(cherry picked from commit f2409608473c06892b087e44e0041c9ade3f9924)

commit_message:
Read mounts from /proc/mounts instead of running mount

When creating multiple concurrent volumes, there's a lock
that prevents mount from returning quickly. Reading /proc/mounts
is way faster.

Change-Id: If31d120955eb216823a55005fdd3d24870aa6b9a
Closes-Bug: #1856889
(cherry picked from commit f2409608473c06892b087e44e0041c9ade3f9924)

The reason to have two aliases is for flexibility.

commit_message:
Modifying wsgi template to add optional config for Kerberos authentication

For the keystone-kerberos charm to configure correctly
with the keystone charm, the apache config needs to be
edited. Also, the alias needs the info of the keystone
context for the location of the script, hence cannot
be put in a separate optional config. It does not affect
non kerberos configuration.

Change-Id: I2842b628f0c3f88bd7efd735f76926b5d34cc108

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-23 21:58:30.000000000', 'message': 'Always set hieradata for certmonger_ca

In commit 37a339d2b0f0282bf1bac96587b10ca61868cec5 , the hieradata
parameter certmonger_ca was set to only be set when internal_tls was
enabled.

This breaks cert issuance by an non-local certmonger CA when the
issuing the haproxy cert on the undercloud eg. issuing this cert by
IPA, which relies on this hieradata being set.

There is no reason to restrict this data from being set, and doing so
fixes the problem. (rhbz#1793975)

Change-Id: If3e3870dd7bd087984e433f7aa832d1bb0ac5b2b
Fixes-Bug: 1860718
'}, {'created': '2020-02-07 20:53:27.000000000', 'message': 'Always set hieradata for certmonger_ca

In commit 37a339d2b0f0282bf1bac96587b10ca61868cec5 , the hieradata
parameter certmonger_ca was set to only be set when internal_tls was
enabled.

This breaks cert issuance by an non-local certmonger CA when the
issuing the haproxy cert on the undercloud eg. issuing this cert by
IPA, which relies on this hieradata being set.

There is no reason to restrict this data from being set, and doing so
fixes the problem. (rhbz#1793975)

The remaining data should be set only when internal_tls is enabled.
Change-Id: If3e3870dd7bd087984e433f7aa832d1bb0ac5b2b

commit_message:
Always set hieradata for certmonger_ca

In commit 37a339d2b0f0282bf1bac96587b10ca61868cec5 , the hieradata
parameter certmonger_ca was set to only be set when internal_tls was
enabled.

This breaks cert issuance by an non-local certmonger CA when the
issuing the haproxy cert on the undercloud eg. issuing this cert by
IPA, which relies on this hieradata being set.

There is no reason to restrict this data from being set, and doing so
fixes the problem. (rhbz#1793975)

The remaining data should be set only when internal_tls is enabled.
Change-Id: If3e3870dd7bd087984e433f7aa832d1bb0ac5b2b
Fixes-Bug: 1860718

commit_message:
Disable grenade jobs from Stein

Rocky is heading into Extended maintenance which means
shouldn't really be worrying about upgrade jobs anymore.

As such, removing the grenade jobs from testing.

Change-Id: Ica0ea37acea44d5b5e6a1927be5d9c51b8f5bba6

commit_message:
Add fip_pf_description extension to be supported by service plugin

In [1] new api extension "fip_pf_description" was introduced but it
wasn't added to the list of supported extensions by port_forwarding
service plugin.
Because of that "description" attribute was unknown for the
port_forwarding resource.
Now this new api extension is added and supported by pf plugin.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670930/

Closes-Bug: #1866560
Partially-implements: bp/fip-pf-description

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711856/
Change-Id: Ibf42a4d276d0141d66ae6e88aa9fbc291eaa4f82

'}, {'created': '2019-06-20 22:05:28.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: Enable IPv6 for FIP and Fast path exit

Enable IPv6 for FIP and Fast path exit. If
service_types network:floatingip_agent_gateway
defined for subnet the FIP agent gateway port
update will depend on service_types else it
will depend on the subnets configured for the
gateway. Also addresses the routes for IPv6

Change-Id: I2cd3fb3d602066d0dc7cf0c088e363698c45b995
Closes-Bug: #1774463
'}, {'created': '2019-06-21 18:54:44.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: Enable IPv6 for FIP and Fast path exit

Enable IPv6 for FIP and Fast path exit. If
service_types network:floatingip_agent_gateway
defined for subnet the FIP agent gateway port
update will depend on service_types else it
will depend on the subnets configured for the
gateway. Also addresses the routes for IPv6

commit_message:
DVR: Enable IPv6 for FIP and Fast path exit

Enable IPv6 for FIP and Fast path exit. If
service_types network:floatingip_agent_gateway
defined for subnet the FIP agent gateway port
update will depend on service_types else it
will depend on the subnets configured for the
gateway. Also addresses the routes for IPv6 since
it is required for the complete IPv6 fast path exit.

Change-Id: I2cd3fb3d602066d0dc7cf0c088e363698c45b995
Closes-Bug: #1774463
